items.title: SEO Sales Executive / Account Manager
items.content:
About Us

Design Your Way LTD is a digital marketing and lead generation startup company. Specifically, our main speciality are high ticket items in Building and Construction projects, but we also operate with smaller industries also. We have a small amount of websites generating leads, however the average value of each lead for the larger assets between £15,000 - £200,000 dependent on project, making the potential profits larger than anticipated. We are now looking to extend the SEO branch of our company, and looking to hire a full time sales executive to outreach for SEO clients.

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced, extremely confident and innovative SEO Sales Executive who can both prospect and sell SEO services to companies in local areas around the United Kingdom. Many of the clients we are aiming for will be local to either borough (London) or city, and the niches will be discussed. We will also need someone who is capable of working from home, as we do not work within an office.

The right salesperson will be able to prospect all potential and future clients, while offering a clients a monthly payment scheme. The candidate will also be able to ensure that all relationships will grow and maintained throughout time, with hopefully some room for negotiation upon cost in the future, however this is not a necessity. Finally, the right candidate will be able to keep in communication with clients during their active status with us. We are not offering a salary for this role, but we are offering 20% of all future profits that you have generated, while the client is still active, even if you leave us. We are also offering you the chance to work remotely.

This role is ideal for anyone looking to earn an extra income working remotely and equally suited to someone with precious sales experience that prefers working on a flexible or freelance basis.

Responsibilities

* Prospect, identify and secure new SEO Clients.

* Maintain and grow relationships between us and SEO clients.

* Negotiate a contract between us and clients that are beneficial for both.

* Able to report all improvements in website rank in keywords, loading times and other significant ranking factors.

* Able to work 2 - 3 days a week.

* Have a clear and concise strategy to secure clients within a suitable time frame.

Skills & Knowledge

* Experience outreaching for and acquiring SEO clients.

* Confidence approaching businesses via calls, e-mail and face to face if necessary.

* Self-motivating and passion for SEO sales.

* Disciplined and targeted sales approach.

* Desire to exceed beyond expectations.

* Confident to reflect and adapt sales approaches both through phone and e-mail.

Benefits

* 20% ongoing profits that you have generated (paid even if you leave us!) and 25% bonus based on performance and speed of client acquisition.

* Remote working.

* Small amount of total clients needed (10 to begin) means very small workload.

* Flexible working hours.

* Opportunity to stay on during future expansion on an improved deal based on performance.

items.content:
Executive Effectiveness Aide | Accountability Coach | Productivity Concierge

Company: Commit Action

We offer:

  • Unparalleled freedom and flexibility (work full time from home!
  • Stimulating, fulfilling and varied work (never be bored!)
  • Comprehensive on-the-job training to build valuable career skills
  • $21 to $28.50 per hour contractor positions

Executive Effectiveness Aide | Accountability Coach | Productivity Concierge 
Commit Action is a growing software AND human-services startup. We work with entrepreneurs around the world to help them become the highest leverage, most productive versions of themselves possible. We solve a problem of increasing isolation and distraction that causes a struggle to stay task-focused for small business owners. 

Our service is a hybrid of productivity software and human-powered expert accountability coaching, delivered by our highly trained “Executive Effectiveness Aides” who act as personal trainer for productivity and concierge for our client’s to-do lists. Our proprietary web app manages and streamlines the Executive Aide’s relationship with our clients. We work with our clients to set powerful goals, track and measure their performance and push them to execute on their dreams. We’re constantly testing and deploying exciting new tech in the growing space of human-powered, software-enhanced services!

Job Description 
Our Executive Effectiveness Aides serve as a close personal advisor to our clients. They are Accountability Coaches but can be thought of as Project Managers for our entrepreneur clients, in which the “project” is the personal day-to-day effectiveness of the client themselves. Our Aides will coach the client, using our proprietary methodology and software to clarify and set meaningful goals in their lives and business. 

Specifically, the role includes: 

• Speaking with Commit Action Inc’s clients each week over the phone
• Collaborating with clients to optimize their task-lists and project plans
• Building strong connection and relationship rapport with a range of diverse people
• Having detailed conversations with business owners about the tactical specifics of their plans
• Sticking closely to a rigorous (but self determined) schedule
• Utilizing our proprietary (user-friendly) task management software platform
• Following up with and maintaining relationships with clients via email and company SMS
• Working remotely and independently as a reliable self-starter

Currently we are only hiring Aides who are located in the continental United States or Canada. We require our team to create their own schedule in a fixed timezone that they can stick to long-term. (Nomads need not apply, sorry!) 

The Executive Effectiveness Aide position is entry level – no experience is required and we provide all training. The job is initially offered as a full time contractor position with salaried positions offered to A-players . 

The team
Commit Action was founded by Peter Shallard – a renowned business psychology expert. The company is made up of client facing “Aide” team members, and customer support and technical (software engineering, marketing etc) who all work remotely.  Our executive HQ and founder are located in New York City and we offer our team of Executive Aides extraordinary flexibility, freedom to set their own schedule and to work from home

We are dedicated to our mission: Helping entrepreneurs be the highest leverage version of themselves possible. 

To that end, we provide a comprehensive on-the-job training program for our Executive Aide team, including training in our specific coaching methodology and in the business vocabulary and conceptual frameworks required to work with our entrepreneur client demographic. 

Culturally, we a are small but fast growth bootstrapping startup that believes in the importance of a “Work Hard and Go Home” principle. We encourage our team to find healthy balance and develop hobbies outside of work itself. We’ve created our Executive Aide role to appeal to people looking for huge freedom, location independence and personal life flexibility - many of our Aide team are actively pursuing personal passions in addition to their full time roles with us. 

Qualifications:

Required:

• Undergraduate degree
• Demonstrating pro-active growth through goal accomplishment 

Preferred:

• Business, Marketing, Finance or equivalent undergraduate degree 

Soft skills: 

• Extraordinary people skills 
• Hungry to learn and practice new skills
• Quick thinking skills and ability to rapidly solve problems in real time
• Have a keen interest in small business and entrepreneurship
• High levels of discipline and conscientiousness - demonstrating the values of personal productivity our company represents

How to apply:
Visit: www.commitaction.com/careers to complete our questionnaire and submit your resumé.

Identity and Access Management / IAM Solutions Architect candidates will have experience with Ping Federate / PingFederate. Candidates will ideally come from a software development background. We will entertain candidates from either end user or service provider backgrounds. This role is remote with flexible hours so candidates can be based anywhere in the US. Must be US Citizens or Permanent Residents with easily understood English speaking skills.

Location - Virtual-Remote-Telecommute - 35% national travel
Starting salary $120,000 to $145,000+ per year, Also part of the comp package are full time health benefits along with significant career progression opportunity.

US citizens or Permanent Residents only

This is a permanent position working for a leading Cyber Security Solution provider servicing large enterprise organizations and US Government agencies.

In this Identity and Access Management Solutions Architect position you will be the primary customer interface and technical authority with regard to IAM products and solutions.

Duties and Responsibilities
-Provides technical design and consulting services on (IAM) Identity and Access Management (IAM) products
-Provides customer specific though leadership and solution construction including installations of Identity and Access Management (IAM) products for User life-cycle management, Identity and Access Governance, Automated Provisioning, (SSO) Single Sign-On, Federation, and Privileged Account Management
-Enhances existing systems by analyzing business objectives, preparing an action plan and identifying areas for modification and improvement
-Creates customer level documentation specific to deployment of IAM products
-Creates knowledge articles for corporate website related to IAM

-Provide regular feedback to the Professional Services Director to guide systems integration methodology and packages service development

Technical Experience and Qualifications
-Experience with Ping Federate / PingFederate
-Lead customer-focused discussions and interact with our customers as the primary technical authority for an engagement
-Ability to present project solutions to clients, manage client expectations, and implement and deliver solutions
-Become a subject matter expert with IAM products and concepts
-Web Application security
-Software Security
-HTTP and related technologies
-Database/Directory integration
-x509 Certificates
-Windows, Unix, Linux
-Plusses experience with IAM products: Radiant Logic, Sailpoint, Centrify, ForgeRock, Ping Identity, IBM, Okta, Oracle, RSA, simeio
-Federated Identity and Single Sign-On
-Access Management and API Gateways
-SAML, WS-Federation, OAuth, OpenID Connect, and/or SCIM standards
-RADIUS and/or KERBEROS
-APIs (SOAP, XML, REST, JSON)
-Social APIs including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.
-User Directory (Active Directory OpenLDAP, OpenDJ, etc.)
-Java and/or .NET development
-Amazon's AWS services (i.e. VPCs, SES, RC2, R3, Route 53, Cloud Formation, etc.)

  • provided by Dice Ping Federate, Solution Architect, IAM

items.content:
US Campaign Manager

Company: Sumofus

Summary

SumOfUs is hiring a Campaign Manager to help lead our digital campaigning. This is a full-time position based anywhere in the United States. The ideal candidate has 4-6 years of strategic campaigning experience, including at least 2 years of experience in digital campaigning. If you love leading diverse distributed teams and you’re bursting with new ideas for mobilizing massive numbers of people to fight corporate power, then this is the role for you. Applications close 11:59 pm Eastern Standard Time on Friday June 22.

A bit about us

SumOfUs is a community of people from around the world committed to curbing the growing power of corporations. We want to buy from, work for and invest in companies that respect the environment, treat their workers well and respect democracy. The biggest corporations in the world rely on ordinary people to keep them in business. We are their customers, their employees, and often their investors. When we act together, we can be more powerful than they are. Together, our community of millions act as a global consumer watchdog – running and winning campaigns to hold the biggest companies in the world accountable.

What you’ll do as part of our team

  • Develop and execute winning campaign strategies for fighting corporate power in the US and around the world;

  • Lead the US regional team with support and oversight from a Campaign Director to achieve impact, fundraising, and organizational goals;

  • Supervise, mentor and train campaigners;

  • Write and edit action and fundraising mailings and social media content that motivate SumOfUs members and help win campaigns; and

  • Help craft compelling narratives that engage our members in an empowering story of fighting corporate power.

Skills and experiences you’ll need to bring

We have no formal education requirements – if you take on the role and are willing to grow with it, that’s all that matters. This role requires you to be:

  • Experienced with digital-first models of campaigning;

  • A fantastic manager of staff and leader of teams (bonus points for managing teams remotely);

  • Demonstrably able to develop and lead impactful and innovative campaign strategies across at least two issues areas (e.g. access to health care and climate change);

  • Experienced building effective partnerships with advocacy and activist groups;

  • Have a deep understanding of the US political context;

  • Multi-talented and willing to learn and do anything to see the job through;

  • Comfortable in fast-moving work environments;

  • Dedicated to building a fairer and more sustainable global economy;

  • An excellent writer and communicator;

  • An enthusiastic technologist and experimenter; and

  • Fluent in written and oral English.

Big pluses

We don't expect you to have all of these! A strong candidate will likely have 2 or 3 of them.

  • Proficiency in major world languages other than English -- especially Spanish (native-level fluency is even better!);

  • Experience managing a large email list (100,000+ subscribers);

  • Experience with using digital tools (e.g. P2P texting) and tactics for online/offline distributed organizing and mobilization;

  • Experience with online fundraising;

  • Experience working closely with communities affected by corporate accountability issues -- from indigenous communities to low-wage workers;

  • Experience working in or closely with the labor movement and/or shareholder activism  movements in the US;

  • Knowledge of and relationships with policy experts and campaigning groups in key issue areas like ethics of technology companies re: human rights and privacy, tax justice, workers’ rights, agribusiness, climate change, the global financial system, and trade;

  • Experience with market campaigns or corporate accountability issues;

  • Experience working closely with decision-makers at multinational corporations in a CSR context;

  • Deep understanding of the operations, structures, regulations, and incentives within a key industry or corporate sector -- technology, finance, agriculture, etc.;

  • Experience living or working in multiple regions of the world;

  • Experience working with mobile technology and user interfaces;

  • Experience using SQL and data and experimentation tools (e.g. Optimizely), ideally in a campaigning environment.

Further details

Compensation is competitive and will be determined based on a combination of experience and cost-of-living in the region you live in (for some context: for qualified applicants, this position in New York City will pay between approximately $72,000 and $80,000).

We offer significant benefits, including the ability to work from home or a co-working space, flexibility to set your own hours, five weeks vacation time per year, additional paid-sick leave, paid parental leave, private health insurance, and opportunities to travel internationally. This position will report to the Campaign Director with oversight of the US regional team. The successful candidate would be a member of the staff union and subject to the terms of the bargaining contract between IFPTE Local 70 and SumOfUs.

SumOfUs is an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of SumOfUs to provide equal employment opportunity to all applicants for employment and employees and not to discriminate because of race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, disability, marital status, personal appearance, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibilities, matriculation, genetic information, or political affiliation. Equal employment opportunities will be provided in employment, recruitment, selection, compensation, benefits, promotion, demotion, layoff, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment.

People from communities that traditionally experience discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity or immigration status; women; people with disabilities; trans, non-binary and genderqueer people; and LGBQA people are especially encouraged to apply.


How to apply:
Please use the form at www.sumofus.org/about/jobs/ and follow the instructions there.

Enterprise Account Manager

Sales
US East Coast
Company: InVision
Full Time

Overview

 is the world’s leading design collaboration platform.

InVision

At InVision, Account Managers to work with some of the largest and most interesting companies in North America.  Your role would be to to authentically prospect, onboard new clients and work with them to expand their relationship with InVision.  We are a customer centric organization so this requires individuals who place the success of their clients and our company at the top of the priority list.

InVision enables companies to discover the power of design-driven product development. That’s why over three million designers, product managers, marketers and other stakeholders at so many of the world’s most loved  use InVision every day.  We’re well-funded and venture-backed by prominent investors including FirstMark Capital, Tiger Global Management, Accel Partners and ICONIQ Capital.

startups, agencies, & corporations

Requirements:
  • > 2 years of full cycle sales experience in a B2B SaaS vertical
  • Proven track record of exceeding quota
  • Passion, enthusiasm, energy, humor, and the ability to convey this through phone and email communications
  • Ability to help people think about their problems differently and provide solutions
  • High degree of comfort with outbound calling
  • Enthusiasm for giving and accepting feedback
  • Ability to work in a remote and ever changing environment
  • Desire to make their teammates, clients and company successful

    • Responsibilities:
    • Exceed quota
    • Build a sales pipeline, both individually and in collaboration with extended teams (customer success, business development, marketing, support, etc)
    • Manage full sales cycle in a consultative manner
    • Strong negotiation skills
    • Communicate clearly and effectively across the business and with leadership
    • Protect the authenticity and integrity of InVision’s brand

      • Benefits:

      InVision offers an incredibly unique work environment. The company employs a diverse team all over the world. In the United States we have teams including hubs in New York, San Francisco, Austin, Portland, and Boston. Each InVision team member is given the freedom and tools to do their best work from wherever they choose. Among our benefits we offer competitive health plans, 401k, a flexible vacation policy, unlimited Starbucks cards for each employee, and unlimited books related to your profession.

      InVision is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

items.title: Senior Staff Accountant
items.content:
Senior Staff Accountant at Philips

Remote
  • United States of America – Home Based
  • Full-time
  • 284360

Job Description

THIS IS A TEMPORARY FULL-TIME ROLE

In this role, you have the opportunity to

Maintain control, allocation, recording and physical verification processes for Philips fixed assets and Payroll accounting activities.

You are responsible to

  • Coordinate with Infosys to ensure that bookings / accounting is accurately and timely maintained. Review that all balances are correctly held and that adequate reconciliations are available with appropriate documentation.
  • Verify compliance with accounting standards and regulations (PAP, IFRS, local regulations). Support the local ORUs and Infosys in providing accurate and timely data for group consolidation & reporting (Month End Close).
  • Provide accurate & timely data for fiscal reporting and other requirements.
  • Complete Internal Controls work in accordance with the Internal Control Standard (ICS) tool on a timely and accurate basis.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in accounting.
  • Four year degree in Finance or Accounting highly preferred
  • Knowledge of general accounting procedures. Knowledge of office administration and procedures.
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and nonverbal. Attention to detail.
  • Proficient in relevant computer applications and strong knowledge of word processing, spreadsheet and ERP accounting software.

In return, we offer you

  • A career with a world-class brand committed to improving people’s lives through innovation
  • Global multi-functional opportunities to advance your career

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

Philips is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability, and protected veteran or marital status.

As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans’ Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.

items.content:
One in five households in the UK live in social housing, a sector with the right values at its core but that has historically struggled to deploy innovations in the home. Many residents still can’t afford to heat their homes and live in cold, mouldy properties they can’t be proud of. At Switchee, we believe that everyone deserves to live in a decent home and that the environments we inhabit have a massive influence on our ability to enjoy life and prosper.

We may be only three years old, but it’s already been quite a ride! Our first product, the internet connected Switchee thermostat is already in 35 of the biggest housing providers in the UK. We’re growing 100% year on year and are backed by some of the best-known investors in technology and social impact.

To strengthen our small team of 15 passionate and ambitious people we are looking for an outstanding individual to join us as

*Customer* *Account* *Manager*

We are driven by a collective desire to make a positive impact in the housing sector, both for residents and landlords, so your commitment to our values and mission are paramount.

*Your* *responsibilities*

As Customer Account Manager you will be responsible for all Switchee’s interactions with our most important Housing Association and Local Authority customers. You will co-ordinate the various touchpoints the Switchee team has with each customer, typically taking ownership from sales and working with our operations, development, marketing and leadership teams. Your ultimate responsibility will be the successful delivery of Switchee services to our large, complex landlord customers with the aim of building long-term (multi-year) commercial relationships based on trust. As we continue to develop our technology an important part of this role will be to develop a deep understanding of both our customers’ and end users needs so that you can input into Switchee product development.

Being more specific, you will:

* Be the main point of contact with up to 20 Switchee Customers
* Co-ordinate and oversee communication with each customer from various parts of the Switchee team; ensure that all deliverables are met on time
* Actively seek and grow relationships with all parts of each customer organization, focusing on relevant decision makers
* Pro-actively develop a deep understanding of customer and resident needs and how Switchee can either solve them today or develop solutions and/or commercial partnerships to solve them in the future
* Monitor and proactively grow the usage of Switchee data insights by all parts of a customer organisation
* Suggest and present new product features to our development team, demonstrating a clear understanding of customer value and the need for ROI
* Be constantly aware of the need to deliver customer and resident value and to measure and objectively report on this to a range of stakeholders
* Be aware that successful implementation of Switchee’s technology does not stop at the delivery of a dashboard, but will ultimately require changed customer behaviour (for example the switch from reactive to pro-active maintenance)
* Understand that blockers may be cultural/behavioural as well as technical and thrive in finding solutions to these
* Contribute to the growth of Switchee by building long-term commercial relationships with each customer


We are a company built on a strong technical foundation. You’ll need to grasp and communicate a technical solution with clients. We also expect you to work closely with Product Development to ensure our product evolves with the customer’s needs at the very centre.



*Your* *experience*

We firmly believe extraordinary people can come from a wide range of places – but we wouldn’t be surprised if the person who gets this role has:

* At least 3 years’ experience in management consultancy or a similar commercial field
* Bachelor’s degree from a top university
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Proven ability to develop and implement effective solutions to complex commercial problems
* Strong analytical & numeracy skills with complete command of Excel
* Fluency with large data sets and an ability to interrogate them for commercial insight
* Comfort talking in detail about the technology and processes required to manage large customer accounts
* B2B customer facing experience preferred
* Experience in a small & quickly expanding business
*Knowledge of the housing sector
* Experience working with Internet of Things devices


*You*

We are a diverse bunch of people at Switchee. That said, there are some characteristics we always look for:

* You deeply care about Switchee’s mission; you have a desire to build something revolutionary, that will disrupt an industry, and positively impact ordinary people’s lives.
* You care about the environment, are interested in energy efficiency and have thought about the challenges and opportunities posed by an evolving domestic energy market
* You like technology and neat solutions to complex problems
* You thrive on challenge and change; you naturally gravitate to the hardest questions first and love thinking differently to solve them.
* You are biased towards action and you’re happiest when you’re ‘getting stuff done’.
* You’re open, positive & straightforward. You’re not afraid to stand up for your convictions, even when it’s hard to do so.
* You delight in your colleagues’ successes and thrive on your failures; you grasp any opportunity for learning and constantly seek to improve.


*Our* *mission*

We believe that radical innovation in internet connected technology can ensure that every resident, every day, is living in a home that allows them to succeed. That’s why our products are built not just on great technology, but on an understanding of what people want from the space they live in.

This approach led us to reimagine the most mundane household object, a thermostat, into a product that automagically reduces energy bills, looks great and offers control to those who want it.

We are also revolutionising the way social landlords manage their housing stock with an obsessively tailored SAAS property dashboard and handy alerts on things like when the boiler is going to break.

Our next project is to build the ultimate connected hub for the social home. It’s going to revolutionise the way residents interact with their properties and landlords manage their homes.

*Life* *at* *Switchee*

We like to keep things simple and flexible at Switchee and consider you to be joining our family. We don’t currently track holidays so you’re free to take as much as you need. We occasionally work remotely but are sensitive to the needs of our colleagues.

We socialise together with regular outings in London and an annual “working remotely” trip where you have the option (but not obligation) to join us in working from a fun location.

If we end up working together, we can offer a competitive salary and a generous stake in the company.

If you believe in the same things, don’t hesitate any longer, apply now! Please be in touch soon as we’ll proceed once the right person is found. If you’d like to apply please submit a CV and cover letter on our Careers page.

You'll be working directly with the head of marketing to unroll a mix of digital marketing activities:

-Ad campaigns on Adsense, Facebook and the app store
-Social media management—both content creation and lead generation
-Affiliates & partnerships — strategic alliances with influencers

We are looking for creative individuals eager to learn and get involved in a small team venture-funded startup. Depending on performance and commitment, your unpaid, 5-10 hour/week internship may turn into paid contracts or even full-time employment.

What We're Building

CDC reports 1 in 4 children under age 5 has developmental issues resulting in 1 million kids every year entering school with an undiagnosed disability. BabyNoggin is a population health app platform that educates parents on developmental milestones & vaccines- empowering parents to do screenings at home, integrates data & results to their physicians and helps refer the child to local resources and community health centers when in need.

BabyNoggin, Qidza’s first product, focus on baby’s first three years. We
1. educate pediatricians and parents on developmental screenings through step-by-step video and written instructions, recommended by the American Academy of Pediatrics.
2. Teach parents personalized activities that cover language, autism, sensory, motor, and cogitative, all translated from peer-reviewed clinical studies and powered by our machine learning
3. work with nonprofits to identify and connect the 25% of kids who are at risk of developmental delays.

items.content:
Executive Effectiveness Aide | Accountability Coach | Productivity Concierge

Company: Commit Action
Headquarters: New York, NY
www.commitaction.com/careers

We offer:

  • Unparalleled freedom and flexibility (work full time from home!
  • Stimulating, fulfilling and varied work (never be bored!)
  • Comprehensive on-the-job training to build valuable career skills
  • $21 to $28.50 per hour contractor positions

Executive Effectiveness Aide | Accountability Coach | Productivity Concierge 
Commit Action is a growing software AND human-services startup. We work with entrepreneurs around the world to help them become the highest leverage, most productive versions of themselves possible. We solve a problem of increasing isolation and distraction that causes a struggle to stay task-focused for small business owners. 

Our service is a hybrid of productivity software and human-powered expert accountability coaching, delivered by our highly trained “Executive Effectiveness Aides” who act as personal trainer for productivity and concierge for our client’s to-do lists. Our proprietary web app manages and streamlines the Executive Aide’s relationship with our clients. We work with our clients to set powerful goals, track and measure their performance and push them to execute on their dreams. We’re constantly testing and deploying exciting new tech in the growing space of human-powered, software-enhanced services!

Job Description 
Our Executive Effectiveness Aides serve as a close personal advisor to our clients. They are Accountability Coaches but can be thought of as Project Managers for our entrepreneur clients, in which the “project” is the personal day-to-day effectiveness of the client themselves. Our Aides will coach the client, using our proprietary methodology and software to clarify and set meaningful goals in their lives and business. 

Specifically, the role includes: 

• Speaking with Commit Action Inc’s clients each week over the phone
• Collaborating with clients to optimize their task-lists and project plans
• Building strong connection and relationship rapport with a range of diverse people
• Having detailed conversations with business owners about the tactical specifics of their plans
• Sticking closely to a rigorous (but self determined) schedule
• Utilizing our proprietary (user-friendly) task management software platform
• Following up with and maintaining relationships with clients via email and company SMS
• Working remotely and independently as a reliable self-starter

The Executive Effectiveness Aide position is entry level – no experience is required and we provide all training. The job is initially offered as a full time contractor position with salaried positions offered to A-players . 

The team
Commit Action was founded by Peter Shallard – a renowned business psychology expert. The company is made up of client facing “Aide” team members, and customer support and technical (software engineering, marketing etc) who all work remotely.  Our executive HQ and founder are located in New York City and we offer our team of Executive Aides extraordinary flexibility, freedom to set their own schedule and to work from home

We are dedicated to our mission: Helping entrepreneurs be the highest leverage version of themselves possible. 

To that end, we provide a comprehensive on-the-job training program for our Executive Aide team, including training in our specific coaching methodology and in the business vocabulary and conceptual frameworks required to work with our entrepreneur client demographic. 

Culturally, we a are small but fast growth bootstrapping startup that believes in the importance of a “Work Hard and Go Home” principle. We encourage our team to find healthy balance and develop hobbies outside of work itself. We’ve created our Executive Aide role to appeal to people looking for huge freedom, location independence and personal life flexibility - many of our Aide team are actively pursuing personal passions in addition to their full time roles with us. 

Qualifications:

Required:

• Undergraduate degree
• Demonstrating pro-active growth through goal accomplishment 

Preferred:

• Business, Marketing, Finance or equivalent undergraduate degree 

Soft skills: 

• Extraordinary people skills 
• Hungry to learn and practice new skills
• Quick thinking skills and ability to rapidly solve problems in real time
• Have a keen interest in small business and entrepreneurship
• High levels of discipline and conscientiousness - demonstrating the values of personal productivity our company represents

Apply for this position

Visit: www.commitaction.com/careers to complete our questionnaire and submit your resumé.

items.content:
We are Resi. The straight-forward modern architect.


We believe in making world-class residential architecture accessible to all. Through our use of technology, we can offer a high quality and cost-effective service right across the UK.


Working here, you’ll discover that we do things a little differently to our competitors. We’re looking to shake up the architecture industry and so need an ambitious, no-holds-barred team to make this happen.


We have a fun, dynamic team, located in Bermondsey (though we’re moving to Elephant & Castle soon). Currently, we’re a small team of under 30, but we’re growing quickly and on the hunt for someone with a bit of hustle to join our business development team. Nope not cold calling. You help answer questions that homeowners might have before they commission us to undertake their project.


Most companies say they are an equal opportunities employer, but we really mean it. We are led by a female CEO and a female CTO. We actively encourage people who feel like they don’t fit the traditional stereotypes to apply. Your experience is all that matters.


Experience
• Likes helping people and talking
• Can hustle or put differently, can build rapport with people – we don’t like the hard sell
• 1-2 years sales experience (in any setting)
• Can write well
• Is diligent and hardworking
• Has a thirst for knowledge and picks things up quickly


Desirable but not essential:
• Has studied architecture (or even incomplete) or some form of construction experience
• Understands or has experience working on a building site, the lifecycle of a house extension (maybe you have done one) in an architecture firm or as a supplier (could be flooring / glazing / kitchens)


What we offer:
• A good London-based salary
• Commission
• The opportunity for rapid progress
• Ownership of your work & area
• On the job training
• 30 days holiday (inc Bank Holidays)
• The chance to help build a company from the ground up


All applications should include a CV and a cover letter/email as to why you think you would be a good fit for Resi

items.content:
Partnership Manager

Various
Anywhere
Fully Remote Company
Company: Zapier
Full Time

Overview

Hi there!

We’re looking for someone who’s eager to help our largest and fastest-growing partners, like Google, Trello, Facebook, and Slack, succeed in launching and growing their Zapier integrations. If you’re excited about SaaS, APIs, building win-win relationships, and automation, then read on.

We know applying for and taking on a new job at any company requires a leap of faith. We want you to feel comfortable and excited about Zapier. To help share a bit more about life at Zapier, here are a few resources in addition to the job description that can give you an inside look at what life is like at Zapier. We hope you’ll take the leap of faith and apply.

  • Our Commitment to Applicants
  • Culture and Values at Zapier
  • Zapier Guide to Remote Work
  • Zapier Code of Conduct
  • Diversity and Inclusivity at Zapier

    Zapier is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.

    Even though our job description may seem like we’re looking for a specific candidate, the role inevitably ends up tailored to the person who applies and joins. Regardless of how well you feel you fit our description, we encourage you to apply if you meet these criteria:

    You’ve built a career on building relationships, marketing is something you live and breath, you excel at following up with others, and you are intrigued by new products and technology.

    About You

     You’ve had extensive experience in a Partnerships capacity on a SaaS or web product.

    This is not your first rodeo.

    You prioritize creating, nurturing, and managing personal relationships over relying on hastily-made contacts.

    Meaningful relationships maximize your success. 

     You are quickly able to assess a partner’s marketing assets, channels, intended audience, etc. and design a marketing plan that benefits both parties.

    You’re a marketer at heart.

    From composing a short, convincing email to penning an 800-word persuasive blog post or the world’s punniest tweets, you don’t stop honing your craft.

    Writing is a skill you sharpen non-stop. 

    You don’t hesitate to reach out to a new partner, deliver a presentation, or negotiate a win-win deal. You can navigate large organizations and zero in on the right decision-maker.

    You make fearless asks. 

    You think about how a potential partnership will solve customers’ problems with practical use cases.

    You strive to build partnerships that benefit customers and partners alike. 

     You’re comfortable looking for and suggesting improvements to an integration based on reading through a tool’s API docs.

    API documentation is familiar territory.

    You consistently automate time-consuming processes to free up time for more meaningful work.

    Efficiency impacts outcomes. 

    When you’re given a task, you take ownership and find an effective way to complete it, whether or not it requires dozens of Google searches.

    Action beats inactivity. 

    You strive to improve your work and expand your industry and marketing knowledge.

    Learning gives you satisfaction. 

    Things You Might Do

    Zapier is a small, fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you’ll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you’ll probably do:

    • Build and maintain relationships with Zapier’s top 100+ partners
    • Find creative ways to surface Zapier inside our partner’s products where customers would be looking for integrations/automations
    • Inject yourself into partners’ upcoming roadmaps; persuade them to work with Zapier, plan and execute product launches that highlight Zapier
    • Motivate partners to participate in Zapier marketing opportunities (new feature releases, app roundups, etc.)
    • Gain understandings of partners’ users and show them practical use cases for Zapier
    • Listen to partners and document their needs/requests in our feedback database
    • Coordinate with Zapier’s product teams to deliver the tools your partners need and with Zapier’s content teams to deliver long and short-form content that inspires their users to automate their work.
    • Experiment: this is a startup so everything can change
    • As part of our initiative, every week help customers have the best possible experience with Zapier
      • All Hands Support

      How To Apply

      We have a non-standard application process. To jump-start the process we ask a few questions we normally would ask at the start of an interview. This helps speed up the process and lets us get to know you a bit better right out of the gate.

      After you apply, you are going to hear back from us, even if we don’t seem like a good fit. In fact, throughout the process, we strive to make sure you never go more than seven days without hearing from us.

      About Zapier

      For the past six years, Zapier has been helping people across the world automate the boring and tedious parts of their job. We do that by helping everyone connect the web applications they already use and love.

      We believe that there are jobs a computer is best at doing and that there are jobs a human is best at doing. We want to empower businesses to create processes and systems that let computers do what they are best at doing and let humans do what they are best at doing.

      We believe that with the right tools, you can have big impact with less hassle.

      We believe in small teams. Small teams are fast and nimble. Small teams mean less bureaucracy and less management and more getting things done.

      We believe in a safe, welcoming, and inclusive environment. All teammates at Zapier agree to a.

       code of conduct

      The Whole Package

      Location: Planet Earth.

      If you want to work remote, that’s great. If you want to work near others, that’s cool too. Our team of 100+ is distributed because it lets us work with the best people. You don’t have to be located in the USA either. Some team members live in the United Kingdom, Thailand, India, Nigeria, Taiwan, Guatemala, New Zealand, Australia, and more! You just need the skills and drive to succeed in this role and the ability to work from anywhere.

      Compensation:

      • Competitive salary (we don’t use remote as an excuse to pay less)
      • Great healthcare + dental + vision coverage*
      • Retirement plan with 4% company match*
      • Profit sharing
      • 2 annual company retreats to awesome places
      • 14 weeks paid leave for new parents of biological or adopted children
      • Pick your own equipment. We’ll set you up with whatever Apple laptop + monitor combo you want plus any software you need.
      • Unlimited vacation policy. Plus we require you to take at least 2 weeks off each year. We see most employees take 4-5 weeks off per year. This isn’t a vague policy where unlimited vacation means no vacation.
      • Work with awesome companies around the world. We partner with great software companies all over the world and you’ll constantly get to
        • interact with people from these great companies

        *While we take care of our international folks as best we can, currently, healthcare and retirement plans are only available to US-based employees.Optional: to help us better track trends related to the backgrounds of candidates interested in working at Zapier in order for us to build a team that represents the users at Zapier and the broader world population.

         Share anonymously some demographic information about yourself

        Zapier is an equal opportunity employer. We’re excited to work with talented and empathetic people no matter their race, color, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, or age. Our code of conduct provides a beacon for the kind of company we strive to be, and we celebrate our differences because those differences are what allow us to make a product that serves a global user base.

        To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://zapier.com/jobs/275A6AB793/partner-manager-key-accounts/ →

items.content:
Splento is an Amazon-like hybrid marketplace that controls the entire visual content creation, curation and distribution process from start to finish: from how you make your booking, to customer support, to photo editing, delivery, storage and sharing.

This is an opportunity for full-time Sales Manager to help grow and build our sales team. You’ll be working in a fast-paced environment, as part of a small sales team, reporting to Head of Growth. The role is varied, with plenty of opportunities to learn.

The opportunity to grow is huge, and your salary will be topped up by incentives and commissions.

We are looking for:
– Experienced sales executives/managers who want to take their game global
– Experience in events is a huge +
– Experience with Hubspot is a huge +, but training will be provided
– Good managerial skills
– Excellent organisational & reporting skils
– Excellent command of the English language
– Strong written and verbal communication skills
– Time management skills and the ability to meet deadlines
– Someone interested in working in a fast-paced startup environment
– Eligible to work in the UK


Perks include:
– Free coffee and tea when in the office :)
– Flexible working hours and working remotely/from home is fine, but we prefer to have at least 4 days in the office.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Strategic:
Communicate customer feedback to technical, marketing and management teams in order to develop processes for better serving customers.
Prepare templates for routine customer correspondence for future optimisation
Assist in training peers on improving sales skills
Develop and maintain in-depth product knowledge
Develop innovative and creative ideas for increasing sales
Follow communication procedures, guidelines and policies

Tactical:
Actively engage existing customers through calls, networking and social media
Maintain weekly reports of sales and feedback, so as to develop sales analytics and trends
Keep records of customer interactions on HubSpot
Prepare sales presentations and proposals for customers
Organising sales meetings

items.content:
*Role Summary*

We have an exciting opportunity for a sales professional to join our team as an Account Executive. Your role will be working as a valuable member of our sales team managing relationships with our amazing partner accounting firms.

We're growing at an incredible rate and generating huge growth in the accounting channel. This is a perfect time to join Chaser and make an instant impact and contribution to the company's success.

Chaser Account Executives are at the heart of our sales and customer service offering. Taking a consultative approach to form strong relationships with our accounting partners, assisting and guiding them with cloud strategy.

As cloud accounting adoption keeps increasing within accounting firms, you will have the unique position to help support and increase their client portfolio by adopting Chaser into their firms. You can truly help them become more efficient, add real value to their clients and help them become that go digital accounting firm they strive to become.

You'll be reporting directly to the Head of Partner Channel Sales. Our head office is located in Moorgate London; however, we do offer remote working for the right candidate.

*As a person you:*

* Have highly developed communication skills and a positive demeanour
* Are consultative, process driven and persistent, with excellent professional written and verbal communication skills
* Hard working but like to have fun and come to work with a smile on your face
* You will be extremely ambitious
* You will be someone who thrives in a high speed environment
* Digitally proficient, you will be excited to build an understanding of how best to use Chaser as a product. This will be essential for your success in the role

*What your role will consist of*

* Building a deep understanding of accounting and bookkeeping firms
* Acting as a trusted advisor to our accounting and bookkeeping partners and supporting change management in their firms
* Educating partners to help maximise growth
* Managing and respond to incoming partner enquiries
* Monitoring all existing and prospective partners progress through the sales funnel
* Maintaining and update the CRM system of all partners staff and contact details, alongside adding new partner enquiries
* Creating and running webinars
* Providing both online and onsite demos of Chaser

*Why you'll love Chaser*

At Chaser we value our people, we want them to enjoy the job they do and provide opportunities to love and grow their career. An exciting growing company we attract people who want to help us have a positive impact by helping our partner and their clients thrive and be successful. Our passionate, innovative Chaser team strive every day to make a meaningful impact. At Chaser, we truly value the input of every single member of the team. If successful, you'll be joining a sharp, welcoming group of people who will help you learn new skills and develop as an individual.

*Benefits*

* Competitive salary
* Share options
* Company pension scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours

If you're looking for a role that is exciting, challenging and diverse in which you can form lasting business and personal relationships, apply for the Chaser Account Executive position today.

*How to apply*

In applying, please answer the following questions:

* Why have you applied for this role?
* What is your proudest professional or academic achievement and why? - ( Max 200 words)
* Are you eligible to work in the UK?

items.title: Student or Graduate Sales Exec position
items.content:
Driven Media is a Truck and HGV advertising specialists. We utilise the valuable but often unused space on the side of trucks, and rent it to run campaigns for our clients and advertisers.

Following our appearance on Dragons Den, and successful investment at the start of this year, we are now looking to expand our remote sales team and take on 2 or 3 current students or recent graduates who want to make a name for themselves.

The role involves marketing your respective geographical areas, and utilising the contacts and companies at your disposal in order to get our brand name out into the market place. You will be tasked with landing 3/6/ 12 month campaigns and will receive a healthy commission percentage in return. We are also offering initial and ongoing training, a Sales Buddy to guide and support you with your clients, and will support you with generating inbound leads, marketing and how get the best form your sales efforts.

In addition to a healthy 10% commission per campaign (average client campaign being worth £8,000), you can also benefit from a lucrative 'fast start' bonus, which rewards those team members who hit the ground running, and have the passion and stamina to succeed in the highly competitive market that is advertising space. This bonus scheme could be with up to £3,200 extra within your first 6 months!

So if you are a fast self-starter, wanting to make a name for yourself in sales and marketing, love negotiation and closing deals, and want to earn uncapped commission to subsidise your studies, please apply below and lets start a conversation.

Every relationship has to start somewhere, and this could be your next big opportunity.

items.content:
Account Executive

Company: Help Scout

At Help Scout, the sales team serves as a trusted advisor for prospects and customers -- listening to their needs, clearly explaining what’s possible, and leading training/onboarding efforts to make sure everyone is successful for the long term. Quite simply, you’ll have the opportunity to impact small businesses in a big way on a daily basis.

About the role

  • You’ll partner with customers through the entire buying process, from initial evaluation to close, and through onboarding of the entire team. You’ll be the primary point of contact through the first year renewal.
  • You’ll team with marketing to ensure inbound campaigns are well coordinated as you follow up to qualify and close those opportunities.
  • In most cases you’ll be partnering with SMBs between 10-250 people. On a monthly basis you’ll have the opportunity to close several new deals and get them on track with the product.
  • The companies you work with will be qualified and passed to you based on the number of expected Users. They will mostly be trial signups, webinar attendees, or inbound leads we’ve talked with to get a high-level understanding of their needs. You’ll also work with existing customers on high-value upgrade and expansion opportunities.
  • Most of your time will be spent working with stakeholders over email and on the phone, and doing demos. There’s a reason we call you a trusted advisor -- this is less about the hard sell and more about having the product knowledge, passion and people skills to let the product sell itself.
  • Based on what works, you’ll experiment with, measure and document strategies that help us increase sales effectiveness. You’ll be a critical part of helping us enhance our sales playbook.
  • You’ll be proactively reporting on learnings and valuable feedback to the product team so that we can improve the product and prioritize the right projects.

About you

  • You have 2+ years of successful selling to SMBs, and have experience working on deals similar in size and volume to the ones you’d be working on at Help Scout.
  • You are in sales because you love helping people win. It energizes you to work alongside people to improve their business.
  • You are naturally curious and have a history of learning new things quickly. This is especially important in a remote company like Help Scout, as you won’t always have people nearby that you can talk to and learn from.
  • You excel at managing yourself like a successful business -- highly organized, setting and achieving goals with regularity, creating a great customer experience, and making your teammates better.
  • You have experience tracking all of your sales activity and reports with Salesforce.
  • As the primary point of contact and a trusted advisor, you’re happy to wear several hats: sales, support, customer success. Over the course of a customer’s first year, you may be point person on any one of them, mobilizing your teammates for support.
  • Above all, you’re an entrepreneur and are excited by the prospect of building your business and hitting your quarterly and annual goals.

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary - We pay at or above market salary in most cases and evaluate a lot of research to make sure everyone is paid well. The formula we use to calculate all salaries is public to employees and is improved upon regularly.
  • Health and dental insurance - We cover you and your family's health/dental insurance 100%. If you are based in the US, we'll cover you on our Aetna policy. If you're based outside the US, we offer a healthcare stipend.
  • Long-term/Short-term Disability Insurance & Life Insurance - We cover 100% of the premiums for LT/ST Disability insurance and base Life Insurance. You also have the option to purchase supplementary life insurance through our provider. (currently US only)
  • Flexible vacation - Take time off when you need it, we trust you.
  • Paid parental leave, including adoption and foster care - 12 weeks for primary caretaker and 4 weeks for secondary caretaker.
  • 401k with 1% match - via Betterment for Business (currently US only)
  • Personal Development stipend - Up to $1,800 per year to improve your craft
  • Great tools - Each employee will be provided with a Mac laptop and 27'' display (or equivalent equipment of choice).
  • Home Office Stipend - You'll also receive $1,000 to spend on outfitting your home office, as well as up to $350 a month to rent a co-working space if you like.
  • Company Retreats - Twice a year, we get together to meet and work in person, covered by Help Scout.
  • Complete transparency - Everyone has full access to business metrics and financial information about the company.
How to apply:
Please submit an application on our website (link above). We can't wait to hear from you :)

items.title: Sales Manager in German SaaS Startup
items.content:
Sales Manager in German SaaS Startup at Filestage

Remote | International

About Us

At Filestage we believe that broken workflows poison teams with miscommunication, friction, and frustration. Our mission is to fuel creative teams with a rock-solid workflow. With our software, we empower people to produce great results together and build healthy and meaningful relationships at work.

Over 500 companies (and growing!) all over the world like Lufthansa, Rabobank or Jung von Matt benefit from happier and more productive employees with Filestage.  We work hard to build great things together—and make time to celebrate our accomplishments.

Your mission

  • You own the sales cycle. You take ownership for midsize to enterprise leads and nurture them throughout the entire sales cycle. With every closing, you have a direct impact on the growth of our company.
  • You create value for our new customers. You develop a deep understanding for the needs of our customers. You present a product solution that makes their workplace more productive and happier.
  • You work on strategy and processes. You identify buying trends, analyze our performance and explore opportunities to improve our process for closing and upselling customers.

You’re good at

  • You love connecting with people. You know the definition of empathy without checking Wikipedia and put it into practice daily.
  • You have a 1-5 years proven software industry experience with B2B buyers. You’ve had prior success in digital, cloud, SaaS sales or consulting and want to take it to the next level.
  • You are fluent in English and have fantastic written and verbal communication skills. French is a plus.
  • You take ownership. You are filled with passion to take responsibility and to make things happen. You are an energetic self-starter who wants to make a tangible impact on a growing product and company.
  • You’re cut out for remote working (in case you choose to work remotely). You are highly self-motivated and are comfortable working independently. Ideally, you have already worked remotely in the past.
  • You are a team player. You understand that we can only be successful as a team. Like everyone else in our great team, you are fair, honest and respectful – and you are ready to have a lot of fun.

This is what you get

  • You have the freedom to work wherever you want. Come work with us at our office in Stuttgart (Germany) or work remotely.
  • You have a steep learning curve by working hands-on together with highly talented minds.
  • A fair compensation. You get a fair base salary based on your skills and the option to participate on the long term success if you’re a high performer.
  • Your opinion matters and your work is valued. You have the chance to make a difference and grow our sales team together with our CEO.
  • You’re tired of useless meetings and slow decision making? We have flat hierarchies, no bullshit meetings and we move fast.
  • You work with top-notch technologies and lean processes. We use Slack, Asana, Hangouts -and of course Filestage- to communicate efficiently.

What are you waiting for?

To land this gig, please apply here: https://goo.gl/forms/nRVK1jrgzGBA7N4d2

We’re looking forward to your application!

Apply for job

items.content:
Knowledge Base Manager

Are you passionate about product management? Do you enjoy writing customer-facing content? Now, imagine this — you get to work directly with fellow product managers to create support articles that help companies set product strategy and create roadmaps.

You should know that we think about customer support differently. Our all-remote team works closely with customers to highlight what's possible with our software — sharing product management best practices and expertise.

We are looking for a self-starter with superb writing and technical chops. If this is you, we want to hear from you!

As a Knowledge Base Manager at Aha!, you will have an excellent opportunity to join a breakthrough and profitable company that is growing fast. tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
US Expat Tax Accountant at Greenback Expat Tax Services

Remote | Freelance | International

(CPA or EA)

Location: Remote, work from home, any time zone or geography

Greenback Expat Tax Services is a company that specializes in preparing tax returns for Americans living overseas. We are a highly energetic, positive, resourceful team working virtually across the globe. We believe that executional excellence is key to success.

At Greenback, we provide you with the tools that you need to be successful and we bring our clients to you so that you can focus on preparing expat taxes and providing exceptional customer care!

This is not a traditional JOB- it’s more like a business partnership- and is ideally suited for those folks who love the idea of their earning potential being tied to their individual accomplishments, are obsessively organized and have a natural flair for customer care.

What we’re looking for:

  • CPAs or EAs with 3-5 years of experience preparing US expat tax returns, including specific experience with the additional forms and schedules required for expats (1116, 2555, FinCen 114, 5471, 3520, etc.)
  • People who are comfortable managing their own schedule and workload. There are no set hours- you get paid for the work you do and your results. You take on as many customers as you choose (we pre-agree annual targets)
  • People who see technology as an enabler and embrace it fully. We use state of the art systems (Salesforce, Box, ProSeries, and Lacerte).
  • People who are extremely organized, especially in managing around deadlines. This is a deadline-driven business, so anyone who gets frazzled near a tax deadline or disorganized will struggle.
  • Strong attention to detail. Mistakes on tax returns are not cool. We need people who make sure there’s never an error or an oversight.

Why work with Greenback?

  • Again, this is not a traditional 9 to 5. No one has set hours- you have specific responsibilities and obligations related to timeliness of customer care, but it’s up to you to set a schedule that meets those timings.
  • No office/no commute. You have ultimate flexibility to decide where you work from and when you work. Want to spend tax season in your home office and the slower season working a lighter load from Mexico or Bali or the coast of Spain? Many on our team do just that.
  • You get paid directly in proportion to how many tax returns you complete. Your earning potential is unlimited and a good number of the accountants on our team earn six figures. However, this is also very personal and is directly in relation to your skillset. If you’re a hustler, have high expertise in US expat tax prep, work hard and stay organized, this is a great opportunity for you.
  • We have frequent bonus opportunities for excellence in staying organized, timeliness and attention to detail. We’ve heard our accountants described as “personal tax time hero’s”-we compensate accountants above the standard per return pay for above and beyond customer care
  • This opportunity is an ideal fit for people who are happy to work on their own, but don’t want to manage the business logistics like marketing, customer acquisition, billing, customer service, etc
  • We’re maniacal about customer care- we expect everyone to have an experience with us that makes them want to go straight out and tell their friends how wonderful Greenback is. Accountants who feel that’s important thrive with us and love how happy their customers are at the end of each tax season.
  • You will have access to a peer group of 30+ accountants that are the best in the industry in regards to not just US expat taxes, but also customer centricity.

And the best news is- we’re hiring! The business is growing rapidly, and we’re looking to staff 5-10 more accountants this year alone.

Apply today!!!

To apply, please visit our website (we only accept applications via our website): https://www.greenbacktaxservices.com/jobs/expat-tax-accountant/.

We will follow up with all candidates within 5 working days with next steps.

Apply for job

items.title: Walk Manager
items.content:
Walk Manager at Susan G. Komen for the Cure

Remote

FLSA Status: Exempt

Location: Dallas, TX/ Remote

Job Description:

Basic Function

The Walk Manager, Race for the Cure, works to drive revenue by assisting Affiliates in expanding their peer to peer fundraising efforts through leadership, resources and training. Works with assigned Affiliates and cross-functional staff to identify benchmarks and standards of excellence in all aspects of Komen Race for the Cure revenue generation and planning. Serves as a subject matter expert to the Regional Directors, Affiliate staff and the local Komen Race for the Cure committees and Board of Directors. Provides strategic advice, guidance, resources and evaluation for development, management, and implementation of Komen Race for the Cure events at the local level. Works with internal and external cross-functional teams in the development of models and supporting resources to build the capacity of the Race series, meet or exceed standards of excellence, and design solutions that ensure alignment of the Race series with the strategic direction of the organization. Evaluates Race series performance to benchmarks and standards of excellence. Leads an integrated Race/Walk program including volunteer engagement, sponsorship development, team activation and fundraising, coaching and training to increase revenue while ensuring a successful participant and partner event experience.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Drives fundraising success through the development and delivery of overall Race for the Cure program strategies and industry best practices.
  • Serves as a subject matter expert to assigned Affiliates to advance the Race series with overall organizational strategy. Provides ideas, resolution, strategy, and direction for assessing Affiliate Race capacity, recommending revenue support models and plans, and evaluating progress of Affiliates to achieve desired goals.
  • Works in partnership with Affiliates to set, monitor, and achieve Affiliate Race revenue and participation goals.
  • Provides strategic direction to Affiliates for development and implementation of advanced fundraising, recruitment and local sponsorship strategies resulting in increased revenue.
  • Leads the identification of benchmarks and standards of excellence (nationally, regionally and/or by Affiliate group) and resource gaps related to building the capacity of the Komen Race for the Cure series. Collaborates with appropriate internal and external resources to fill recognized gaps.
  • Works with Regional Directors to fulfill capacity building recommendations.
  • Performs ongoing analysis for key performance metrics related to registration and participant fundraising behavior
  • Review and recommend updates to Race series policies to Director, Komen Race for the Cure. Develop procedures to ensure compliance with Komen Operational Guidelines and Race related policies.
  • Proactively develops, plans and facilitates advanced RFTC training opportunities offered to Affiliates annually through Affiliate Learning and Development, regional summits, and customized Affiliate training.

Job Qualifications:

Minimum Experience Required

  • 5-7 years of experience in the non-profit sector and peer to peer fundraising. Comfortable with revenue targets and development-driven deliverables.
  • Excellent communications skills are required, with a demonstrated ability to provide complex problem-solving solutions.
  • Must exhibit strong abilities to influence and motivate others with interpersonal and inter-group behaviors in a variety of cross-cultural and cross-functional situations and circumstances.
  • Can mediate between different points of view and seeks to integrate diverse views. Excellent writing and problem solving skills required.
  • Willingness to take personal responsibility for the outcomes resulting from his/her judgment, guidance, and decisions.
  • Proven ability to manage a number of projects with varying priorities at one time.
  • Ability to identify various strategies (operational, logistical, and financial) to maximize assigned Affiliate fundraising events.
  • Extensive knowledge of online communication and fundraising techniques and in-depth understanding of online event management through Blackbaud/Convio TeamRaiser.

Preferred Experience

  • Prefer a candidate with prior national/regional peer fundraising Walk management experience.
  • Direct experience managing Walks over $1 million is also preferred.
  • The ideal candidate is a successful cross-functional team builder with a fundraising focus and strong interpersonal skills.

Specialized Knowledge Requirements

  • Ability to influence, educate, and motivate diverse groups of people. Specialized knowledge in the following areas: peer to peer fundraising, event planning, Convio TeamRaiser, development stewardship, performance metrics and operational planning and evaluation.

Department: Communications/Branding/Marketing

Apply Now: https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=faa94825-da86-4895-b462-ba62627d3e78&jobId=208870&lang=en_US&source=CC3&ccId=19000101_000001

Apply for job

items.title: Sales Development Representative
items.content:
Sales Development Representative at Arternal

Remote

Sales Development Representative at Art-centric Startup

Location: Remote
Comp range: 45-50k base, 65k+ OTE

Arternal

Arternal’s mission: We aim to help art dealers sell more art by operating more efficiently with our CRM (industry-first) and turn their relationships into revenue by leveraging data.

Why this role exists: This role will report directly to the CEO (Sean Green). The mission for the role is to qualify leads by booking high-quality meetings and working with the CEO to close the deal. This role exists to help scale up company sales and maximize the CEO’s time. The goal of this role is to increase the number of deals closed by building relationships with art dealers over the phone, qualifying leads, and booking a meeting for the CEO to close the transaction.

Required Experience:

  • Undergrad degree
  • 2+ years experience as SDR or related field

Additional bonus experience – Art history major, minor. Work in the field. Experience in the art world.

Objective Outcomes:

  1. Work with the CEO to create a sales strategy including the geographic sales focus of the key cities and states to close deals. Optimize the CEO’s time for particular cities and travel schedules by booking east coast meetings when CEO is on east coast, etc.
  2. Create a database of leads (in the defined sales territory) for qualification and follow up.
  3. Create detailed weekly and monthly reports which include calls made, meetings booked, % of numbers that we need to hit to make our sales goals. The report will assess how well we are doing at closing meetings and closing deals.

Core Competencies:

  • Ability to sell, you’re a great salesperson
  • Understands how to sell into someone who “can’t be sold to”
  • Ability to analyze potential leads for Arternal, create and execute plan to get them on the phone
  • Ability to communicate with ease to potential clients, to distill our vision in a way that they will understand and that will resonate
  • Is great at, and enjoys, speaking to leads on the phone

Hard Skills:

  • Strong command of CRM platforms – Rhythm for gathering data and details
  • Strong excel skills
  • Proven ability to source and research leads
  • Ability and desire to learn and implement new sales techniques and processes

Personal + Professional Attributes:

  • Honest
  • Incredible work ethic – if you want to hustle, you’ll fit in with the culture
  • Empathetic
  • Likes to smile and have fun
  • Winning attitude
  • Very curious
  • Goal/target orientated
Apply for job

items.content:
CargoMate Technologies is focused on bringing innovative efficiency to the container shipping industry. We are well funded and backed by one of the UK’s most successful tech accelerators, Entrepreneur First.
We’re developing a range of applications and technologies to record, monitor and analyse container ship cargo operations (i.e. the process of moving containers on and off a ship in port), to ensure ships depart early and consume less fuel on a voyage. Our long-term goal is to bring the widespread adoption of autonomous technologies to merchant ships.

We’re looking for tenacious Sales Development Reps to join our team and help us take our groundbreaking technology to market.

What you’ll do:

- Identify and qualify sales opportunities for CargoMate
- Become an expert in container ship operations and the maritime industry
- Work closely with the Head of Growth and your dedicated Account Executive to identify ongoing strategic target accounts
- Research prospect clients and prepare reports that give your Account Executives everything they need when they go for meetings
- Religiously update Hubspot, our CRM, to stay current on leads and follow-ups
- Shadow your Account Executive at meetings to learn the skills you need to take the next step in your career

What we want:

- A bachelor's degree, or equivalent professional experience
- 1 - 3 years work experience in sales, business development, customer success, or consulting; ideally within technology, SaaS, or shipping and logistics.
- Outstanding communication, interpersonal skills, organisational skills. You should be a great writer, speaker, and most importantly listener.
- Tenacity and fearlessness - you should be willing to speak on the phone with new people every single day to explain CargoMate’s value proposition.
- An obsession with prospect happiness - you need to set the stage for effective follow up conversations and meetings.
- Flexibility - we’re constantly changing and evolving as a team and we want people who are willing to evolve with us
- The ability to challenge the status quo and continuously improve the way we work
- The ability to travel internationally and the desire to work with an international client base
- The intelligence to quickly become an expert in maritime operations, our technology, and sales; and the curiosity to continuously learn about the space as it develops.

What you’ll get:

- A competitive salary plus OTE.
- Support, mentoring, and the tools you need to become world class at what you do.
- The chance to join an early stage business and shape its future.
- A structured path to promotion, with the opportunity to lead a team or become a principle individual contributor as we scale
- The flexibility to work when you want to, and opportunity to undertake remote work once you’ve completed your first few months on the team
