items.title: Director of Sales
items.content:
Director of Sales

Sales
Anywhere in US
Company: Packlane
Full Time

Overview

If you love helping small businesses get their start, and have a knack for sales that can’t be denied, then you’ll be the perfect fit for our Director of Sales role. Our ideal candidate is a whiz at crafting annual sales plans, communicating goals and growth to our executive team, and being a role model manager and mentor to our sales team. A love for beautiful design and packaging is just the cherry on top!

Who We Are

Allow us to introduce ourselves. At Packlane, we empower brands big and small to create beautiful, affordable unboxing experiences that customers will enjoy and remember. From subscription boxes to event swag, eye-catching packaging can help brands connect with their customers – so we do everything we can to make it a smooth and easy process. Our services are trusted by over 15,000 companies including Google, L’Oreal, Casper, Mailchimp and more.

We’re a team of eager self-starters from all over the world, and we’re looking for others to help grow Packlane into the best company it can be. Our core values are creativity (including beautiful design), high quality work, and a passion for what we do. If that sounds like a good fit, we can’t wait to hear from you!

Your Role as Director of Sales
  • You’ll plan, develop, and manage our Packlane Plus sales division consistent with our company’s goals and growth targets.
  • Managing margin levels via constant monitoring and implementation of pricing policies is a constant priority for you. In other words, you’ll keep an eagle eye on order profitability.
  • You can recruit, hire, train, and cultivate the best sales team around! From sales reps to account managers, you’ll be responsible for building a powerhouse department.
  • Everyday is Motivational Monday when you’re around. You’ll work with employees to help them set and exceed sales objectives.
  • Analyze and monitor statistics of core supplier performance and performance to sales goals.
  • You’ll Be the resident know-it-all when it comes to market share position, competitors’ strategies, tactics, strengths and weaknesses
  • You’ll have the power to shape the future of our business, by working directly with the executive leadership team and founder to develop sales techniques and guide and evolve the strategic direction of Packlane Plus
  • Ever calm in a crisis, you’ll respond swiftly, thoroughly and effectively to customer issues to assure satisfactory solutions
  • You build relationships that last. Using customer data, you can support and improve customer retention strategies and tactics.
  • You’ve got one eye on the long game, developing and maintaining a yearly business plan that includes programs for improving the profitability of the company.
  • Work across departments to streamline processes and software to improve sales performance and efficiency
  • And with your excellent people skills, you can seek out major clients and create working relationships with premium buyers

    • Who You Are
    • You have the motivation and skill to manage and grow an inside, outside sales force.
    • This isn’t your first rodeo – you’ve got plenty of experience leading sales in a high growth B2B packaging company
    • Did we mention motivated? A self-starter attitude is necessary when working independently with a remote team.
    • You know what they say, if you shoot for the moon, you’ll land in the stars. That’s why you have a track record of exceeding goals and expectations
    • Excellent verbal and written communication skills (building rapport comes naturally to you!)

Marketing and Business Development Assistant at TrySome

Brooklyn, Remote · Internship
These are early days at TrySome. If you like getting things off the ground, this is for you.Read More

These are early days at TrySome. If you like getting things off the ground, this is for you.

We are working on a mission that can make significant change in the world, now that's serious, but we are not serious!
Come have fun and help us build something incredible together.

TrySome is an innovative online marketplace for health-conscious consumers to discover products that are good for people and better for the planet. Our goal is to connect consumers with brands by online sampling in exchange for their feedback and comments. The products can then be purchased in full size at great discounts.

We are an asset to our manufacturing clients through the accurate and authentic consumer data we create at low cost with a quick turnaround. The data and feedback we provide is valuable information manufacturers use to improve and market their goods.

We lower the financial barriers for people to buy the products that match their health and environmental values while helping manufacturers of responsibly made products thrive.

Applied
Apply to TrySome
Add a message to TrySome
Apply

Job Description

We are looking for a communicative rock star with a passion and willingness to make things happen. If you can't wait to write captivating copy, we can't wait to hear from you.

YOU:
We are looking for an intelligent creative person with excellent verbal and written communication skills to join our Marketing and Communications team.
An interest in organic, vegan and fair-trade products is definitely a plus, but don’t lie about it, it’s not more important than being real.

THE JOB:
You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of digital media and communications tasks including, but not limited to:

- Designing and implementing social media and email strategy to align with TrySome’s business goals
- Generate, edit and publish engaging social media content daily (e.g. original text, photos, videos and news)
- Conduct market research
- Send out email campaigns to our subscribers
- Monitor Google Analytics and web traffic metrics, adjusting social media and email campaigns accordingly to increase web traffic
- Communicate with TrySome subscribers and social media followers. Respond to customer service inquiries in a timely manner and monitor comments and reviews
- Initiate and implement new features to develop brand awareness, like promotions, Instagram challenge or competitions
- Initiate creative growth efforts to increase number of users and manufacturers on the platform

You should have basic understanding of SEO and set up KPIs to monitor progress. You will work directly with the Chief Marketing Officer for guidance.
This position is unpaid and requires a commitment of at least 3 full days per week, preferably full time. If you prove invaluable a full time position is a possibility. We prefer if you are in NYC and can come to the office, but working remotely is an option.

We are looking forward to hearing from you.

Application deadline & start date: Next internship starting in March. Apply asap. We will on-board the first right person.

TO APPLY:

Send us an email with:
- Your resume
- A writing sample (write a draft post for 2 of our 4 different social media platforms). For each post please explain why you think the particular post is good for that particular platform.

Visa Sponsorship
Not available

What We're Building

TrySome an innovative online marketplace for health-conscious consumers to discover products that are good for people and better for the planet. The products can be bought at great discounts, and samples are offered for free in exchange for feedback.

Our approach creates a new connection between consumers and manufacturers that removes the consumers’ risk of making a “wrong” choice and buying a product (which is oftentimes a more expensive choice) that they are not happy with - Try before you buy.

We offer manufacturers the ability to do smart sampling campaigns, which give them accurate and authentic data at low costs in a quick turnaround. We also track when people go from trying to buying products to show conversion trends.

The TrySome community is dedicated to help ethical companies become the brands of the future.
Our goal is to influence purchasing habits towards more responsibly made products, that will benefit the environment and drive positive change for ethical production.

items.content:
Software Sales Manager - CAM (Mediterranean sales territory)
Hypertherm -Home Based
We are seeking a results-driven Software Sales Manager to grow our end-user and channel partner sales and market position for Hypertherm CAM Software (ProNest) in the Mediterranean sales territory. The Sales Manager will represent our industry leading CAD/CAM software designed for advanced CNC mechanized cutting; it’s a single solution for profile cutting requirements including plasma, laser, waterjet, and oxyfuel applications. Our solutions help fabricators and manufacturers to increase material savings, boost productivity, lower operating costs and improve part quality by offering the highest level of cutting expertise.

As a Hypertherm Software Sales Manager, you will:
Balance direct sales to end-users while building existing and new relationships within our integrator/channel partner network
Develop and execute strategies to drive CAM Solution software sales and maximize sales opportunities; including Distinctive Value Proposition (DVP) selling and effective use of our Customer Relationship Management (CRM)
Maintain a high degree of hands-on expertise in Hypertherm CAM Solutions software products and knowledge of the applications they serve
Support channel partners with front-line sales assistance, training and business planning, and effective promotional program delivery
Provide process and product knowledge to the end user and demonstrate compelling ROI
Participate in development and execution of team operating plans and manage budget and expenditure
Create business plans with key partners, including identification and buy-in of mutually beneficial initiatives

Qualifications/Experience:
2+ years of post-secondary education
Proven industry sales skills & related experience
Ability to articulate sales negotiation, problem-solving, and presentation skills
A self-starter with the ability to think critically, multi-task, and succeed independently
Experience with industry standard CAD/CAM software, CRM software, and Microsoft Office
Hands-on technical experience with CNC machining/precision engineering, a plus
Ability to travel 30-50% (throughout assigned territory)
Location: Home-based in the Mediterranean sales territory.

Hypertherm is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

items.content:
Rockstar Graduate Sales Honchos

We’re scouring London for Rockstar Sales Honchos who are talented, inspired and have a tenacious get-up-and-go attitude. Join our fun, fast-growing, early stage prop-tech start-up as a graduate Sales Honcho.

Your role

You’ll be boomeranging around London’s estate agencies, selling in-person, our cutting-edge technology software. The product is the industry-disrupting ‘Agency in a Box’ – which provides agencies with everything and anything they need to manage and grow their businesses. This includes 360° virtual property viewings, mobile apps, websites and entire back office software. All of this can be accessed remotely, anywhere in the world. We are constantly innovating; we are soon to roll out our virtual reality goggles and aerial drones.

We are facing unprecedented demand for our tech, and now is a perfect time to join an early-stage core team. £23k basic, plus uncapped commission which you earn with every sale.

You

• Get up and go attitude
• Enthusiasm
• Work-ethic
• A hunger to learn, improve and succeed
• Proactive
• Confident and fun
• Emotionally intelligent

We will support you to learn, develop and grow throughout this role – providing you with the foundations of a successful career in sales. No experience is necessary – we prioritise tenacity and diligence over everything else.

Show us what you’ve got in your two-month probation period and we’ll completely invest in you. You’ll be the head of a two/three-person appointment booking team that work for you to secure your appointments. You’ll then spend your days smashing them.

Our mission

The GNB was created in 2010 as a charity – set up to end homelessness through a global humanitarian platform. We wanted to fund this ourselves rather than rely on governments and donations… so we started our prop-tech start-up, GNB Properties, in 2016. Our mission is not profit motivated – it is exclusively social. We only exist to serve our mission.

Send us your CV and a short covering letter persuading us why you want to be a Sales Honcho. Our phone number is also below.

www.gnbproperty.com
02037 892 892

items.title: Help Scout: Account Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Account Executive

Company: Help Scout
Headquarters: Boston, MA
https://jobs.lever.co/helpscout/2bae0aaf-a067-4819-b7b8-416f4506e1b5?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=WeWorkRemotely
At Help Scout, the sales team serves as a trusted advisor for prospects and customers -- listening to their needs, clearly explaining what’s possible, and leading training/onboarding efforts to make sure everyone is successful for the long term. Quite simply, you’ll have the opportunity to impact small businesses in a big way on a daily basis.

About the role

  • You’ll partner with customers through the entire buying process, from initial evaluation to close, and through onboarding of the entire team. You’ll be the primary point of contact through the first year renewal.
  • You’ll team with marketing to ensure inbound campaigns are well coordinated as you follow up to qualify and close those opportunities.
  • In most cases you’ll be partnering with SMBs between 10-250 people. On a monthly basis you’ll have the opportunity to close several new deals and get them on track with the product.
  • The companies you work with will be qualified and passed to you based on the number of expected Users. They will mostly be trial signups, webinar attendees, or inbound leads we’ve talked with to get a high-level understanding of their needs. You’ll also work with existing customers on high-value upgrade and expansion opportunities.
  • Most of your time will be spent working with stakeholders over email and on the phone, and doing demos. There’s a reason we call you a trusted advisor -- this is less about the hard sell and more about having the product knowledge, passion and people skills to let the product sell itself.
  • Based on what works, you’ll experiment with, measure and document strategies that help us increase sales effectiveness. You’ll be a critical part of helping us enhance our sales playbook.
  • You’ll be proactively reporting on learnings and valuable feedback to the product team so that we can improve the product and prioritize the right projects.

About you

  • You have 2+ years of successful selling to SMBs, and have experience working on deals similar in size and volume to the ones you’d be working on at Help Scout.
  • You are in sales because you love helping people win. It energizes you to work alongside people to improve their business.
  • You are naturally curious and have a history of learning new things quickly. This is especially important in a remote company like Help Scout, as you won’t always have people nearby that you can talk to and learn from.
  • You excel at managing yourself like a successful business -- highly organized, setting and achieving goals with regularity, creating a great customer experience, and making your teammates better.
  • You have experience tracking all of your sales activity and reports with Salesforce.
  • As the primary point of contact and a trusted advisor, you’re happy to wear several hats: sales, support, customer success. Over the course of a customer’s first year, you may be point person on any one of them, mobilizing your teammates for support.
  • Above all, you’re an entrepreneur and are excited by the prospect of building your business and hitting your quarterly and annual goals.

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary - We pay at or above market salary in most cases and evaluate a lot of research to make sure everyone is paid well. The formula we use to calculate all salaries is public to employees and is improved upon regularly.
  • Health and dental insurance - We cover you and your family's health/dental insurance 100%. If you are based in the US, we'll cover you on our Aetna policy. If you're based outside the US, we offer a healthcare stipend.
  • Long-term/Short-term Disability Insurance & Life Insurance - We cover 100% of the premiums for LT/ST Disability insurance and base Life Insurance. You also have the option to purchase supplementary life insurance through our provider. (currently US only)
  • Flexible vacation - Take time off when you need it, we trust you.
  • Paid parental leave, including adoption and foster care - 12 weeks for primary caretaker and 4 weeks for secondary caretaker.
  • 401k with 1% match - via Betterment for Business (currently US only)
  • Personal Development stipend - Up to $1,800 per year to improve your craft
  • Great tools - Each employee will be provided with a Mac laptop and 27'' display (or equivalent equipment of choice).
  • Home Office Stipend - You'll also receive $1,000 to spend on outfitting your home office, as well as up to $350 a month to rent a co-working space if you like.
  • Company Retreats - Twice a year, we get together to meet and work in person, covered by Help Scout.
  • Complete transparency - Everyone has full access to business metrics and financial information about the company.

Apply for this position

Please submit an application on our website (link above). We can't wait to hear from you :)

items.title: Account Executive
items.content:
Account Executive

Anywhere in the US
Company: CauseVox

FULL-TIME

Overview

 is a community-driven fundraising platform designed for small fundraising teams looking to activate their community, reach new donors, and grow their impact. Since 2010, we’ve been helping nonprofits and social good projects flourish.

We’re a small bootstrapped team (woohoo no VCs) that has grown very quickly. We’re looking for an Account Executive to help us acquire our next 1000 customers.

You’re someone who’s excited about and really good at talking to people, has an uncanny ability to listen and empathize with who you’re talking to, and someone who knows how to tell an amazing story about a product and can get other people really excited about it too.

This is a full-time position. Compensation is $40k – $50k / year base salary + uncapped commission.

We’re a laid-back distributed team based in Greenpoint, Brooklyn (NYC). Remote USA is a-ok too.

REQUIREMENTS

Responsibilities

  • Build, nurture, and track a sales pipeline.
  • Reach out to qualified inbound and outbound contacts via email and phone.
  • Sign up new nonprofit customers by performing sales calls and demos.
  • Upsell exisiting customers on products and services.

Requirements

  • You have 1+ years of sales experience in the software or tech space.
  • You have 1+ years of nonprofit experience (fundraising a big plus).
  • You have rock-solid sales and communication skills.
  • You have the ability to sell to executives and navigate through multiple decision makers.
  • You’re right and left brained; someone who can come up with ideas and execute well on them.
  • You have experience working in a fast-paced small team.
  • You have a proven track record of meeting exceeding sales quotas.

Pluses

  • You have a passion for social good and nonprofits.
  • B2B and SaaS experience.
  • Familiarity with using Hubspot.

BENEFITS

  • Based in super hip Greenpoint, Brooklyn or work at home remotely (anywhere in the USA).
  • Flexibility in work hours.
  • Competitive salary based on experience.
  • Uncapped commission and performance bonus.
  • Equity component in a fast growth company.
  • Paid vacation, plus holidays.
  • Benefits package that include health, vision, and 401k.
  • Professional development reimbursement ($1,000/yr).
  • Work-at-home reimbursement.
  • Your work directly makes a difference in helping people.
Apply for job

items.title: Business Development
items.content:
JOB DETAILS
Hours: 35 hours per week
Pay: £25,000-35,000 per annum plus commission

THE CHALLENGE
Citizen Ticket is looking for an energetic and motivated Business Development Manager in our London office at a very exciting stage in our growth. This position is critical in setting the direction for Citizen Ticket’s UK business development efforts. You will get to work in a lively and dynamic environment in an exciting industry, at the forefront of innovation in ticketing and events.

THE TEAM
The Citizen Ticket team is made up of a small and passionate group that are striving to improve the event ticketing industry through service and innovative technology. We have been consistently growing since our inception in 2013. The current team consists of 3 directors, 2 web & app developers and a marketing manager. We are looking for a full time sales and business development function to help drive the growth of the company.

THE ROLE
Citizen Ticket’s goal is to become the preferred ticketing solution in the UK by providing organisers and attendees with simple and powerful event technology. At Citizen Ticket, you’ll find a team of dynamic, smart and engaged people who are passionate about building communities and creating innovative products to help people get together around live experiences. If you are smart, driven, and interested in revolutionising the event technology industry, we want to hear from you.

YOU WILL
- Attend events, festivals and music industry conferences to network and build your profile in the market
- Develop relationships with high-end event organisers to generate new business development opportunities
- Engage with leads to help prospective clients learn more about Citizen Ticket’s product to win repeat business
- Provide accurate and regular forecasts on the UK events market to the business development team
- Create and maintain up to date leads using our systems
- Close deals, both self generated and lead nurtured

THE SKILL SET
- Great understanding of how to identify target customers, evaluate interest, handle objections and close deals
- Highly confident when pitching, both in person and over the phone
- Excellent written and verbal communication
- A can-do and agile attitude necessary to thrive in a fast moving start-up environment
- A keen interest in and knowledge of the event industry
- A minimum of 2 year’s experience in a business development role
- History of over-performance in previous sales roles
- Polite, well mannered and highly presentable
- Competitive edge and determination to win

BONUS POINTS
- A network of contacts in the events industry

WHAT TO EXPECT?
- A competitive salary package with commission plan and other bonus opportunities
- A fast paced, dynamic working environment
- Flexible work environment, supporting sliding hours and remote working where needed
- Encouraged personal growth
- A young high performing team with a ‘let's make it happen’ mentality
- Team lunches and regular fun team events
- Free Gym, roof terrace, café & bar in the office (Victoria Based)

ABOUT Citizen Ticket
Citizen Ticket is a fast growing event ticketing start-up. We build technology that allows anyone to create, share, find and attend events of all kinds. We specialise in creative and independently run events. We are ethically minded and driven. We strive to make the world of live experiences better for all concerned.

items.title: Sales Trade Account Associate - West Region - Carhartt - Remote
items.content:
Sales Trade Account Associate - West Region
Carhartt -Remote
Position Details

Position Location: Remote
Department: Sales
Reports To: Regional Sales Manager
FLSA: Exempt
Job Band: Sales



Summary

The Sales Trade Account Associate is responsible for executing product and revenue plans for the assigned accounts/territory, monitoring performance, and reporting on all key performance indicators. This position has ownership for all aspects of the account relationship. In addition, this position is responsible for development and implementation of account acquisition plans and at-once business plans to grow brand dominance. These processes involve account planning, account management, financial acumen, and the overall ability to develop relationships from the buyer to the CEO of assigned accounts.
The Sales Trade Account Associate is responsible for delivering against growth objectives by exploring avenues to expand the business through deeper and/or broader strategic partnership with the account. The ability to utilize market insights, channel information, and financial performance to drive focus with the account is critical to this position’s success.



Responsibilities

  • Works strategically to maximize the generation of profitable revenue by maintaining a strategic partnership within the assigned territory
  • Develops annual sales plans for accounts and manage the sell through of product
  • Prospects and develops new accounts
  • Monitors and observes account retail POS data and competitor activity to ensure KPIs are met
  • Monitors account performance against plan; revise selling forecasts when appropriate
  • Recognizes opportunities to drive brand awareness and sales by leveraging the real estate of those partners that can best uphold Carhartt’s Merchandising Standards. Assists Sales Leadership, Retail Marketing and Planning in planning these spaces and prioritizing assortment in an effort to achieve maximum results/ROI
  • Develops a monthly calendar of activities that result in the generation of revenue and support all corporate and regional initiatives
  • Develops and presents sales presentations to accounts including marketing and merchandising programs available for each account
  • Communicates to the appropriate parties issues and opportunities available within customer base
  • Adheres to sales policies and procedures and manage expenses according to corporate guidelines
  • Understands and executes corporate objectives
  • Achieves financial / sales goals
  • Performs other duties as required



Education
  • Bachelor's Degree Required in Business or Related Field
  • Equivalent work experience may be considered in lieu of degree in Business or Related Field


Required Skills and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree (preferably in business or related field) or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 4 years outside sales experience required (apparel industry preferred)
  • Strong planning and critical thinking skills; identifies potential problems, predicts outcomes, and incorporates solutions into a strategic plan
  • Strong communication and presentation skills; demonstrates flexibility in approach based on audience needs and reactions
  • Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills; adept at recognizing who the decision maker is and how to close the sale
  • Strong time management and organization skills; is able to accurately identify true priorities and effectively eliminate barriers to success
  • Demonstrates the ability to integrate our brand strategy, Go-To-Market strategy, product knowledge, and knowledge about competition to clearly articulate the benefits of our products over others
  • Must possess knowledge in account planning, brand marketing, and retail analytics
  • Must be a creative thinker who is able to balance the “analytical” and the “intuitive”
  • Strong Microsoft Office skills



Working Conditions
  • Remote or In-Office
  • Weekend Hours
  • Travel (80%)
  • Moderate Lifting (15-30 lbs)
  • Tobacco Free

items.title: Freelance Writers For A Millennial-Targeted Lifestyle/Relationship Site
items.content:
Freelance Writers For A Millennial-Targeted Lifestyle/Relationship Site

Company: Bolde
Location: Based in NYC, but you can be anywhere

Job Type: Freelance

Description

Bolde is a rapidly growing lifestyle and relationship site for millennial women. We're looking for freelance writers to join our team and provide content that's provocative, unique, engaging and full of personality. Specifically, we're seeking writers who have a strong voice and the ability to write informally and accessibly, in the blunt and engaging way you'd talk to your best friends. We're looking for new and original takes on popular millennial lifestyle and dating topics as well as pieces that discuss issues and viewpoints that other similar sites aren't talking about. First person experience stories are welcome and encouraged too!

If you can write about love and lifestyle-related topics in a thoughtful, fun, and snarky way that appeals to women in their 20s and 30s, please reach out to us! You should feel confident that you have a grasp on the voice and tone of the site and that you're passionate about relationship and lifestyle topics before applying.

Please send us an email to [email protected] telling us a little about your experience and interest in the site. In addition, please include any relevant links as well as five original headline/article ideas that you could see yourself writing/that you think would fit well on Bolde. These should be unique, thoughtful, yet still fit with the tone and voice of the site. Please note that applications that do not include these five article ideas will not be considered.

Because of the large volume of responses we receive, we will only contact you if we think you might be a good fit for the site. Pay rate is $20 per article.

items.content:
Account Executive, Enterprise

Sales
Anywhere in NYC or SF
Company: HackerRank
Full Time

Overview

HackerRank is a Y Combinator alumnus backed by tier one Silicon Valley VCs. We are a skills-based hiring platform that helps companies evaluate technical skills, better. We’re driving a new paradigm shift by eliminating resumes and creating opportunities for hundreds of thousands of programmers worldwide. We have a community of 4M+ developers and 1,000 customers across industries, and the best part is we are just getting started. Our customers –  including VMware, Twitter, Capital One, and many other Fortune 100 companies – rely on HackerRank to build strong engineering teams.

We’ve assembled an amazing team that’s passionate about creating more opportunities for people by changing the way companies hire. We are ambitious, data-driven , and we love delighting customers. If you’re interested in scaling HackerRank by working with some of the largest companies in the world, let’s talk.

givers

WHAT YOU’LL LOVE TO DO…
    • Leadership by inspiring yourself, our company and your customers to embrace a new method of connecting value to customers.
    • Leverage your skills and your customers’ experience to continually evolve the sales process and our product for enabling it.
    • Drive revenue by connecting with customers and building opportunities that will make all parties more successful.
    • Consistently over-achieve the business and revenue objectives set forth in your plan.
    • Develop and execute on a strategic plan for the territory and create reliable forecasts.
    • Work to develop and circulate the set of best practices that will be the foundation of this growing team.
    • Listen to the needs of the market and share with Product and Marketing team.
    • Real-time CRM tracking and updating of your customers. We use Salesforce, but even if you don’t have experience with Salesforce, an understanding of the basics about CRM tool usage is critical, coupled with an appreciation of the value of real-time activity tracking.

      • WHAT YOU’VE ALREADY DONE…
        • You’re ready and willing to dive head first into a fast-paced start-up environment.
        • You have an understanding and passion for technology; you love to stay up-to-date on the latest news in the tech world.
        • You are highly analytical with the ability to assess business opportunities and read prospective buyers.
        • You are capable of developing compelling strategies that deliver results.
        • You gather and use data to inform decision making and to persuade others.
        • You have an innate ability to include multiple partners and members of the company’s management team using competitive selling in order to position products against direct and indirect competitors.
        • You have strong negotiating skills.
        • You’re a forecasting guru.
        • You have a demonstrated ability to find, manage, and close high level enterprise business in an evangelistic sales environment.
        • You have a proven record of overachieving quota and driving results in a high-growth company environment.
        • You have an established reputation as a high integrity top performer.

          • GET EXCITED. Because you’re about to have a huge impact.

          HackerRank is growing fast and we’re having a great time working together as we build! We’re a fun, friendly, passionate bunch. We’re a team of teams and we’re looking for more smiling faces to come join us! The position is full-time and can be worked remotely or out of our Palo Alto, CA office.

          PERKS & BENEFITS. As if working alongside the smartest brains wasn’t enough.

          We have a full package of competitive benefits and perks available for you and your dependents:

          • 100% employee coverage for Medical, Dental and Vision; with 70% coverage for dependents
          • Employee stock options, 401k, flexible work hours and time off, commuter benefits
          • Monthly wellness classes, free lunches, snacks and endless supply of Philz Coffee
          • Ping pong, scooters, foosball, and beautiful trails nearby, to name a few!

            • To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://boards.greenhouse.io/hackerrank/jobs/1223331 →

items.content:
Sales Development Representative

Sales
Anywhere in US
Compensation: $3,000 - $4,000 USD per month
Company: C-Level Connections
ContractFull Time

Overview

C-Level Connections is a fast growing company–doubling revenue every year–that provides professional B2B appointment setting services to customers in all verticals, including technology, medical, HR and finance. Our company is experiencing tremendous growth, and we wish to hire more Independent Contractor Business Development Representatives.

The Independent Contractor Business Development Representative’s role is to drive the development of our customer’s sales pipelines. Your day-to-day activity includes contacting targeted senior executives via email and phone to schedule initial sales appointments with our customer’s sales professionals.

You will be given exceptional training on our customer’s product, qualified lead lists (including contact information), and professionally written email templates.

This position is a full time independent contractor position (minimum 30 hours/week). The hourly pay plus commission is very competitive.

Responsibilities:
  • Contact prospects via email and phone
  • Work efficiently to meet all metric’s requirements (# calls made, # emails sent, and # of meetings scheduled)
  • Introduce customer’s solutions to potential decision makers
  • Arrange appointments with customer’s sales professionals
  • Meet with customers on a weekly basis to discuss and assess sales goals and meetings
  • Document all sales activity in CRM system, Salesforce.com
  • Log hours in the time management system
  • Stay in communication with managers daily via phone and email

    • Qualifications and Experience:
    • Minimum of 3 years successful B2B lead development, inside sales, appointment setting, and/or direct sales experience
    • Strong verbal and written communication skills
    • Comfortable working remotely and able to troubleshoot basic IT issues
    • Basic knowledge of excel
    • Strong organizational skills
    • Ability to multi-task
    • Professional demeanor
    • Familiarity with CRM platforms (Salesforce)
    • Must have access to a computer with current and/or recent Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook programs.
    • Must have functioning headphones with built in mic or external mic in order to access soft phone.

      • Job Types: Full-time, Contract

      Pay: $3,000.00 to $4,000.00 /month

      Ready to apply?

      Please read the full job posting and provide any details requested by the employer. A thoughtful cover letter greatly increases your chances of getting hired

      For this position, please send your job application to: iflanagan@c-levelconnections.com

City Manager - CDMx Mexico at Shippify

We are not a traditional logistic company. Not even close. In fact, we are pretty much the opposite. We're flipping a multibillion dollar industry on its head so we're looking for new team members to join the rebellion.Read More

We are not a traditional logistic company. Not even close. In fact, we are pretty much the opposite. We're flipping a multibillion dollar industry on its head so we're looking for new team members to join the rebellion.

Who we are
Shippify was founded 3 years ago with the clear goal and mission to "redefine last mile logistics" We got tired of having to wait for weeks to receive our online orders; so we decided to "shake up" the traditional logistics industry and established a "new standard” based in technology and an efficient process using crowdsourced models.

Shippify focuses its operations in emerging markets - currently, we have offices and operations in Brazil, Chile, Mexico, and Ecuador. We have created opportunities and an extra source of income for more than thousands of micro-entrepreneurs, while democratizing urban logistics.

Applied
Apply to Shippify
Add a message to Shippify
Apply

Job Description

As a member of this rockstar team of hustlers, you will invade new territories and set up initial operations with lightning efficiency and seamless execution, setting in place a firm foundation that allows each new market you enter to become a new hub of Urban Logistics in your City.

You will be tasked with three critical objectives in every new market or city to launch:

First, you will gather valuable data and insight into the geographic and delivery aspects of the new place.

Second, you will identify and tap into pools of awesome delivery drivers, getting them seriously pumped about landing the best delivery service and collaborative community with us.

Finally, you will identify, recruit, and train a strong local leadership "urban" force to deliver goods and packages on demand.

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

High-energy: Someone who brings a high level of enthusiasm and infectious, positive energy to the role every day.

Like meeting new People: While we are based in Brazil, and work in other remote citys, you’ll be in touch of our awesome team sharing and learning best practices.

Creative Problem-Solver: Quickly comes up with imaginative, novel and executable ideas to tackle unique and challenging problems.

A top notch communicator: A highly articulate person who understands the importance of clarity in everything they do in a business environment.
Willingness to go all-in: Thrives in a true startup environment and loves being in the trenches doing whatever it takes to win and "get it done"

Resilient Self-Starter: Takes the initiative and put themselves out there. Gets up every time circumstances knock you down.

We are looking for the “unique” over the “ideal.” What have you done that others thought was completely crazy? ... You know crazy is complement for us.
If your heart started racing and your eyes widened after reading this… we need to talk , NOW !!!

No Equity

items.title: Salesforce Sales Manager (Remote-Anywhere in USA)
items.content:
Job Description

If you have prior experience selling solutions on the Salesforce platform or have worked at Salesforce then we're interested in you!

We are seeking a Sales Manager that will be responsible for identifying and managing opportunities through the pipeline and closing business with both new and existing customers. You will need to be a people person and be able to build strong relationships with both prospects and customers. You must either have extensive experience selling in the Salesforce ecosystem or have worked at Salesforce to be considered for this

As can be expected, you must be able to generate business opportunities, close deals and target new accounts with existing customers. You will also be required to assist in the RFP process, build proposals, and conduct face-to-face presentations and demonstrations. Experience selling to C-level executives is crucial and the ability to navigate the corporate sales process is pivotal.

This is a full-time, direct-hire salaried position that includes an excellent salary, very achievable high-end OTE, and benefits. This is a remote position and you can be located anywhere in the United States.

items.title: Facebook Ads Manager
items.content:
Facebook Ads Manager

Company: Emily Hirsh, Inc.

Emily Hirsh Inc. is looking for a motivated and experienced, US-based Facebook Ads Manager to join our rapidly growing team. We are a remote digital advertising agency specializing in online advertising for entrepreneurs and small businesses.
We are looking for someone who is available during US business hours. Please note this is a 35-40 hour a week role and we are not looking for contractors for this position.
Role
  • Creating and managing client campaigns on a daily basis through a strategic lens, communicating with the client, sending weekly reports and supporting the client with strategic consultations as needed.
Responsibilities
  • Understanding the strategy of a specific campaign and client funnel.
  • Tasking out different components of a campaign such as images and copy to the correct contractors.
  • Loading or tasking the loading of campaigns/ads to the ads specialists.
  • Reviewing, editing & loading of ad assets as needed.
  • Placing and verifying pixel to ensure proper campaign tracking.
  • Daily optimization of campaigns to ensure the lowest possible cost per result and an overall positive ROI.
  • Proactively create, execute, and optimize creative strategies to consistently drive high-quality leads, traffic & visibility.
  • Produce weekly reports for client account updates, recommendations and results.
  • Follow-up with client communications, questions and concerns in a timely manner.
  • Stay on top of new techniques, strategies and changes to test for better client results & campaign successes.
  • Communicating with clients about the success of the campaign, and offering suggestions for ways to improve.
  • Schedule & perform monthly client meetings & consultations for account goals and strategic success of each client account.
  • Participate in daily, monthly and quarterly team huddles to ensure agency team members are all meeting company goals & responsibilities.
Results (What results do you expect in the first 90 days in this position & what results do you expect in the long term)
First 90 days: Learn each assigned clients account and launch strategies with direction from the Director of Advertising to ensure proper execution of client goals and success. Master the “Hirsh Process” for proper client account management and ongoing optimization. Feel 100% confident by the end of the 90-day period that you can manage your accounts with minimal support and oversight needed from the Director of Advertising or the CEO.
After initial 90 days: Ads Manager should be able to perform all client tasks, communications and strategy consulting with minimal direction from the Director of Advertising and moving to be a trusted main source of contact for strategy consultation for the client while reporting to the Director of Advertising for strategy updates, guidance & insight. The ads manager will continue to learn and grow and bring innovative strategies to the Hirsh Agency and our clients.
Requirements
  • 2+ years of online marketing experience
  • Dedication to problem-solving and ability to analyze results and make suggestions to the client based on their individual results
  • High attention to detail, proofreading, writing and editing skills for accuracy
  • Mid - Expert level knowledge of Facebook advertising (minimum 1-2 years experience)
  • Quick learner who retains information easily.
  • Knowledge of various 3rd party platforms such as ClickFunnels, MailChimp, etc.
  • Ability to communicate effectively.
  • Access to a high-speed internet connection.
  • Good time management and organization skills as a remote worker.
  • Ability to communicate with clients via email & video meetings.
  • Understanding of Funnel Marketing strategies & the psychology of advertising to the customer journey.
  • Excellent verbal communication skills.
  • Committed to ongoing education and training to stay on top of the Facebook platform, rules, regulations, strategies and updates for proper ad execution, implementation & client success.
Details: (Pay and hours)
  • Paid training that leads to base and incentive compensation based on performance.
eoberman@emilyhirsh.com

items.title: Salesperson
items.content:
Salesperson

Headquarters: Remote

Hi there.  We’re Paperless Pipeline, and we’re looking for a salesperson to join our small but highly impactful team of 12 fun-loving, go-getters spread across the U.S.   

Here’s what our next dream teammate looks like:

About You

  • You are legally permitted to work in the United States.

  • You are comfortable working without constant supervision. You channel self-motivation and discipline to get things done. On time.

  • You love listening to people. You ask great questions because you know sales success is all about asking meaningful questions, listening, and grasping what prospective customers want to accomplish.

  • You communicate clearly and explain things in a simple way.

  • You take pride in your work. But you thrive on critical feedback.

  • You have hands-on experience with B2B SaaS.

  • You pay attention to detail.

  • You are obsessed with and have a proven track record of continuous improvement.

Your Responsibilities


  • Collaborate with Paperless Pipeline’s sales and customer care teams to delight new and prospective customers.

  • Become an expert on Paperless Pipeline’s strengths and capabilities.  Provide purposeful consultation to prospects who have created a free trial account.

  • Pre-qualify prospects by inbound and outbound phone calls and emails.

  • Proactively follow up with prospects by phone, email, and live chat to help them customize and effectively use their trial account.

More About Paperless Pipeline


Paperless Pipeline (aka Pipeline) is the simple yet powerful real estate transaction management software loved by nearly 70,000 real estate agents and brokers across the U.S. and Canada.

Pipeline is a bootstrapped, profitable, and self-sustaining business that has steadily grown since its inception in 2009.

Our team is small by design because that enables us to be impactful, effective, and responsive to customers’ needs.

Learn more at paperlesspipeline.com.

How to Apply

Send an email to [email protected] and include the subject line: Salesperson

We ignore run­-of-­the-­mill résumés and LinkedIn profiles. So tell us your story with a thoughtfully written email instead. 

To apply: See how to apply section above.

What We're Building

People with autism can use this software to have immersive experiences with computer-generated full body avatars that can be fully interactive, with emotional facial expressions, body language and animations in real time.

The complete system called 3D Digital Puppeteer (TM) allows parents, therapists and children with autism to improve their social, conversational and motivational skills. It incorporates automatic lip sync, easy-to-use pentablet controls and a library of colorful characters in vivid background environments, ready to engage people of any age. They can either control the avatars like puppets or be part of the audience.

Scientific research has identified the value of VR and live animation in helping those with autism thrive, but no company has ever offered such a powerful and complete solution. And our development plans will take us onto game consoles like XBox in the coming year.

items.title: Client Services Account Manager
items.content:
Client Services Account Manager

Our unique London-based B2B prospecting service is looking to recruit an outgoing Client Services Account Manager. You’ll be responsible for taking the lead on the day to day client management, building rapport with both new and existing clients and working closely with the internal teams to deliver campaigns. You’ll hit the ground running digesting briefs, managing the copywriting and client onboarding processes. No 2 days will be the same so it’s important that you thrive in a fast-paced environment and have the ability to manage workload efficiently.

Founded in 2017, we are on a mission to provide best-in-class, white labelled, business
development services which translate into new sales opportunities for our clients.

To be considered, you must possess the following experience/skills.

-An expert listener - empathetic to the needs of our clients.
-Ideally, you’ll come with a few years’ experience working in a client facing role, ideally within sales and marketing.
-You’ll be highly organised with the ability to manage clients from a diverse workload.
-Commercial awareness, with the ability to manage and grow your accounts.
-You’ll have the ability to build relationships with ease and you’ll keep a cool head under pressure.
-A team player attitude, ready to roll up your sleeves and get stuck in.
-Able to build and develop long-term client relationships.
-A background in Business Development is desirable.
-A background in working for Start-ups.
-Comfortable working remotely.
-Proficient in Excel, Powerpoint, Word and the suite of Google cloud-based products.
- Familiar with using all Social Networking platforms - specifically LinkedIn
- A natural flair for marketing would be an advantage.
-Comfortable learning and working with online software packages.

This full-time position offers flexible and remote working conditions, however, you will be expected to travel to London on occasion for training and meetings.

Shrinking violets need not apply - we need a confident, self-motivated, proactive individual. We are a fast-paced, ever-changing start-up, and we need someone who comes up with ideas and isn’t afraid to share them! For the right person, we offer the opportunity to work for a modern, progressive company. You will have the ability to join us at a very exciting time of growth. Joining us from this early stage will allow you real scope for career progression, and you will be key to driving our continued success. We are looking for people that can inject new ideas and initiatives to support the ongoing growth and expansion of the business. Alongside a competitive salary, fun social events, employee discounts, and company pension scheme you’ll be joining a team of world-class experts in a Sales agency that offers outstanding training and progression.

As part of the interview process, you will be expected to clearly demonstrate how you managed the expectations of clients and resolved difficult challenges. You will also demonstrate how you went beyond the call of duty to support a client's need.

We are an ambitious and enthusiastic Venture Builder, empowering visionary entrepreneurs to build the best startups in FinTech, EdTech, HealthTech etc, around the globe. Born in Singapore, with European and Japanese roots and a highly diverse team spanning 20 countries, we aim to become the largest tech startups builder in the bustling South East Asia.
Founded by a successful serial entrepreneur, and scaling up at a fast pace, Creatella is co-launching a series of new startups full of challenges, sweat and excitement, and we now look for passionate and ambitious people to join us and contribute to our rapid expansion across Europe.

Interested in joining a thrilling project from the first development to the release?
Apply at: joinus@createl.la

WHAT YOU’LL DO
■ Identify and generate new leads in the European market (preferably where you are based)
■ Leverage your local network to connect with entrepreneurs and startups
■ Nurture opportunities into contracts
■ Assist in the building projects from the ground up, making them meaningful and beautiful
■ Build up and maintain strong relationships with influential entrepreneurs in Europe and establish partnerships
■ Administration of work including the preparation of quotations and contracts
■ Manage an effective clientele/customer communication through Google Drive and Slack channels
■ Work closely with the CEO and Europe lead and develop your skills with a diverse, international startup
■ View and contribute to the entrepreneurial journey and development of the whole startup. No better way than to learn how to do it yourself now!
■ Share your ideas and knowledge with the eager members of the team
■ Available full-time or part-time

YOUR SKILLS
■Keen interest in strategic B2B sales and business development. Having experience is a plus!
■Familar with tech dev processes. You don’t need to be a developer, just passionate and knowledgeable about all things tech, from web technologies and websites to mobile apps and more.
■Pleasant character with good inter-personal skills is important.
■ Good relationships with an active network in entrepreneurship and coworking spaces/incubators is a bonus!
■Clear, concise and effective communication skills (in your own native language,too!)

WHAT WE OFFER YOU
■A happy, remote team of experts in various fields - from engineers to digital marketers - supporting your activities
■Excitement of setting up new regional coverage and project autonomy
■Flexibility to work remotely where you want and when you want
■A skyrocketing learning curve (we give you the freedom to take on challenges, and we know that failing fast is an opportunity to learn)
■Develop your entrepreneurial side
■Additional opportunities as we grow and learn together
■ A unique learning opportunity with our founder, in an empowered environment with no ceiling and plenty of development opportunities

PERSONAL QUALITIES (as important as skills!)
■Entrepreneurial: You might be already be a founder or have that startup spirit - you certainly don’t want to just be an employee.
■ Creative: You think outside the box. We want your ideas and feedback not only for the projects you’re a part of, but also for the whole company
■Timely and committed: You manage your time well
■Challenger: You like to push yourself and go beyond your own goals. We’re ambitious and we want you to be too!
■Quality-driven: You create great work you’re proud of!
■Fast learner: You’ll learn a lot with us, and we move fast!
■Team player: You share, discuss, ask for advice, and report on your work regularly. You’ll work independently, we don’t want to be on your back ;-)

OTHERS
■Work comfortably from home, remotely, with fully flexible hours and lots of freedom

If you want to explore your full potential, work on the most exciting projects and learn from our talented team, building entirely new startups from their inception, apply now at: joinus@createl.la. Please share about your experience, what you want to do and become, and why Creatella.

items.title: Emily Hirsh, Inc. : Facebook Ads Manager
items.content:
Facebook Ads Manager

Posted Jun 25

Emily Hirsh, Inc.
Headquarters: Remote
https://emilyhirsh.com
View all Emily Hirsh, Inc. jobs →

Emily Hirsh Inc. is looking for a motivated and experienced, US-based Facebook Ads Manager to join our rapidly growing team. We are a remote digital advertising agency specializing in online advertising for entrepreneurs and small businesses.
We are looking for someone who is available during US business hours. Please note this is a 35-40 hour a week role and we are not looking for contractors for this position.
Role
  • Creating and managing client campaigns on a daily basis through a strategic lens, communicating with the client, sending weekly reports and supporting the client with strategic consultations as needed.
Responsibilities
  • Understanding the strategy of a specific campaign and client funnel.
  • Tasking out different components of a campaign such as images and copy to the correct contractors.
  • Loading or tasking the loading of campaigns/ads to the ads specialists.
  • Reviewing, editing & loading of ad assets as needed.
  • Placing and verifying pixel to ensure proper campaign tracking.
  • Daily optimization of campaigns to ensure the lowest possible cost per result and an overall positive ROI.
  • Proactively create, execute, and optimize creative strategies to consistently drive high-quality leads, traffic & visibility.
  • Produce weekly reports for client account updates, recommendations and results.
  • Follow-up with client communications, questions and concerns in a timely manner.
  • Stay on top of new techniques, strategies and changes to test for better client results & campaign successes.
  • Communicating with clients about the success of the campaign, and offering suggestions for ways to improve.
  • Schedule & perform monthly client meetings & consultations for account goals and strategic success of each client account.
  • Participate in daily, monthly and quarterly team huddles to ensure agency team members are all meeting company goals & responsibilities.
Results (What results do you expect in the first 90 days in this position & what results do you expect in the long term)
First 90 days: Learn each assigned clients account and launch strategies with direction from the Director of Advertising to ensure proper execution of client goals and success. Master the “Hirsh Process” for proper client account management and ongoing optimization. Feel 100% confident by the end of the 90-day period that you can manage your accounts with minimal support and oversight needed from the Director of Advertising or the CEO.
After initial 90 days: Ads Manager should be able to perform all client tasks, communications and strategy consulting with minimal direction from the Director of Advertising and moving to be a trusted main source of contact for strategy consultation for the client while reporting to the Director of Advertising for strategy updates, guidance & insight. The ads manager will continue to learn and grow and bring innovative strategies to the Hirsh Agency and our clients.
Requirements
  • 2+ years of online marketing experience
  • Dedication to problem-solving and ability to analyze results and make suggestions to the client based on their individual results
  • High attention to detail, proofreading, writing and editing skills for accuracy
  • Mid - Expert level knowledge of Facebook advertising (minimum 1-2 years experience)
  • Quick learner who retains information easily.
  • Knowledge of various 3rd party platforms such as ClickFunnels, MailChimp, etc.
  • Ability to communicate effectively.
  • Access to a high-speed internet connection.
  • Good time management and organization skills as a remote worker.
  • Ability to communicate with clients via email & video meetings.
  • Understanding of Funnel Marketing strategies & the psychology of advertising to the customer journey.
  • Excellent verbal communication skills.
  • Committed to ongoing education and training to stay on top of the Facebook platform, rules, regulations, strategies and updates for proper ad execution, implementation & client success.
Details: (Pay and hours)
  • Paid training that leads to base and incentive compensation based on performance.

Apply for this position

eoberman@emilyhirsh.com

Companies from all over the world trust 1Password with their passwords, credit cards, and more. As a Business Sales Specialist, you’ll be the first point of contact for businesses that are considering 1Password. You’ll get the opportunity to help them learn more about the product, understand the best ways their team can use it, and get them started with a trial.

What you’ll do

- Help new business get started with 1Password, and keep the relationship with them strong.
- Proactively report on what potential clients need, and valuable feedback from existing ones, so the product team can improve the product and prioritize the right projects.
- Get to know potential customers over discovery calls and demos, and develop a relationship with them.
- Close several new deals per month, and generate new leads through outreach.
- Try new things: if something isn’t working, try a different tactic, reach out to the product team with questions, and help us reach different types of clients we haven’t encountered before.

What you have

- Passion for helping people succeed and feel more confident in their work.
- Experience with how businesses use software to be more productive and efficient.
- Adaptive explanatory skills that get people to understand, not just hear, what you're saying.
- A knack for learning things on your own and quickly adapting to new environments. Since 1Password is remote, it’s important to be independent in your research, but also have the humility to ask for help when you aren't sure about something.
- Excitement to speak with new people every day and do product demos and presentations with them.
- An understanding that conversation is about listening.

What you also might have

- Experience selling a product to someone – your siblings are lovely, but they don’t count.
- A track record with the acronyms SCIM, AD, CLI, SSO, and of course SAAS.
- Polyglottism! You could go to France or Germany for a week and jump right in to conversation, or do that from your computer, with a French riviera as your wallpaper.
- Personal experience with 1Password.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Do you get excited at the prospect of meeting innovative software startups and scale ups in the UK? Do you have experience in talking to founders and directors and have a curiosity to find out more about their underlying technology advancements and funding challenges?

Do you want the freedom power and trust to do great work? This role could be for you.

GrantTree was founded 7.5 years ago and employs 35 people. As a company we're self-managing, we call this an open culture. It’s been successful for us so far, a rewarding and somewhat unusual working experience for self-motivated individuals (you should check out our GlassDoor reviews https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Reviews/GrantTree-Reviews-E855262.htm).

This is the ideal environment for creative, independent people who are open to developing through challenging work, and we're growing!

GrantTree are looking for a Business Development Executive to join the expanding sales team. We do well on conversion and retention and we're looking for an innovative self-motivated lead generating powerhouse to help build an even stronger pipeline.

Requirements:

Our Sales team is...

High-reaching
Brilliant at conversion
Formed of talented individuals each with their own creative way of building effective relationships.
If you could see yourself in our team please keep reading.

About you
You're a self starter with a keen interest in software and an existing network which ideally reflects this.
Your communication skills are expert level, whether you're at a networking event or qualifying on a phone call you strike the magic balance between giving and receiving information.
Sending emails, contacting prospects via LinkedIn, networking at events; your routes for finding and qualifying prospective clients is diverse and effective.
You’re a lifelong learner ready to apply your innate curiosity to how businesses operate and how they get funding.
You'll typically be the first point of contact and use your experience to lay the foundation for a strong client relationship.
You're a truly great teammate and get satisfaction from reporting on individual results as part of the sales teams targets.


This role is an exciting opportunity for someone with 2-3 years of new business experience who thrives on generating and managing a pipeline. We have talented people in our sales team who can transform your hot leads into tangible business, so you can spend more time meeting people and generating leads, your specialist area.

Benefits:

We believe that people should be rewarded fairly for the work they do. At GrantTree there is no secrecy over salaries and the way we work them out. For this role, this is likely to lie between £28k-£33k depending on experience.

Our sales team does not work on a commission basis, and this role is no exception. We focus instead on offering an attractive overall package. This way, you can to get involved in other important areas of the business (like inventing new products). You are also free to sell to the right people, in the right way. If commissions are important to you in staying motivated, this is not the role for you.

Aside from money, we offer a place where you can be yourself. We want you to develop your skills and fulfil your potential. We have a flexible approach to working, and some of our staff work remotely most of the time. Our office near Old Street is bright and airy, with a fab roof terrace. You can take up to 6 weeks as holiday each year.

Equal Opportunities
Teams are stronger when they have a diverse range of people. Applications are accepted from everyone, regardless of the categories they put themselves in. We also encourage talented ‘square pegs’, who don’t neatly fit into the person specification, to apply.

Are you excited by GrantTree but not sure about this role? Please feel free to send your CV to granttree@jobs.workablemail.com so we can contact you about future vacancies.

By applying, you're telling us you're OK with us processing your data for recruitment purposes only, according to the terms of our recruitment privacy policy.

items.content:
*Summary*

Konnektis is on a mission to radically change the way care is delivered to people in their own homes, to place the person at the centre and ensure they receive the best care possible.

We are looking for an enthusiastic, passionate individual to join our team as a Customer Relationship Manager, who can have a significant impact in growing our customer base, whilst also managing existing relationships.

The right candidate will have experience making sales (ideally in the public sector), be ready to build relationships and networks within the ecosystem and be confident in moving discussions forward with C-level executives within Local Authorities and CCGs. They will be able to make sense of complex operational activities and have a genuine enthusiasm for leading on conversations about the future of the health and care sector.

Konnektis is operating with Local Authorities and Health Trusts/CCGs in the North of England and is funded to roll out its next stage of growth. This role will be based in the North of England.

We’re excited about our next stage of growth and want to continue to build our team of passionate individuals who are driven by the potential for technology to make an impact in the health and care sector.

*Responsibilities*

* Managing existing customers, prospective relationships and ecosystem relationships in the North of England

* Leading on customer research, identifying and qualifying leads and closing sales

* Working closely with the Founder CEO to secure, prepare and conduct sales meetings with Local Authorities and key stakeholders such as Health Trusts/CCGs

* Assisting in product design and roadmapping to ensure we are developing high impact functionality for customers and our end users, and handing over well developed project plans to our service delivery team

* Representing Konnektis at events and acting as an ambassador

*Requirements*

We’re looking for someone with:

* Commercial experience building relationships and selling to customers, ideally in the public sector and an ability to confidently engage with people at all levels of public sector organisations

* A genuine interest in the health and care sector and belief in the potential for technology to improve delivery in the sector

* A strong work ethic, who is independently driven and is able to work remotely

* Excellent oral, written and graphical presentation skills

* An ability to understand and explain the technical side of the Konnektis service

* An ability to understand health economics and the Konnektis value-add

*About us*

Konnektis believes in the power of technology to improve people’s lives in health and social care and combines this with a passion for putting people at the heart of everything we do.

The Konnektis digital platform transforms care delivery by providing an internet-enabled tablet device that replaces the paper records currently used in domiciliary and reablement care. It enables individuals in the care network to access, record and share information in real-time. In parallel, it enables the individual to use the tablet to engage in their own health and wellbeing to the fullest extent possible.

Konnektis aims to be the in-home platform of choice that records and shares the information that supports home care of older people, a growing multi-billion pound market driven by an ageing population and the need for integrated care services.

*Location and package*

* The role will be based in the North of England. Konnektis is currently based in Bradford and Manchester and can offer flexibility of work location for the right candidate

* The role will come with an attractive salary

*Apply by sending us your CV and a short email explaining why you want to join us.*

www.konnektis.com

Sales Development Representative (contract – $15/hr)

Posted Jun 12

Inside.com
Headquarters: SF
https://inside-com.breezy.hr/p/f9ce7f8b8017-sdr
View all Inside.com jobs →

Inside.com is a network of email newsletters. We publish high quality roundups that curate, summarize, and analyze all of the most important news in many different verticals and industries. Some examples are cybersecurity, electric vehicles, virtual and augmented reality, artificial intelligence, drones, and more.

Over the past 18 months, we’ve grown from an audience of 500 readers to an audience of 500,000 readers, and we’re just getting started. Because our audiences are targeted, highly engaged, and highly influential, brands want access to them. That’s where you come in.

We have a team of 4 sales reps, and they need leads. We’re looking for someone to help build and operate a lead-gen process for our sales operation. This role consists of:

  • Sourcing lead pools. Figuring out where we can discover the companies that might make good partners for our newsletters.
  • Identifying leads. Figuring out which people at those companies would be the best fit.
  • Developing leads. Tracking down contact information and other relevant details.
  • Sales operations. Working with our sales team to improve processes and better serve clients.
Here are some key requirements:

  • 3+ years of professional experience (Doesn't need to be in sales!)
  • Hustle. You need to be able to track down busy people and get them to talk to you. This requires creative communication, research, and hustle.
  • Persistence. We mentioned this above, but it bears reiteration. You might need to email someone 6 times before you catch their attention. We need someone willing to push hard.
  • Communication. This is a growth position, not an editorial position, but we are an editorial-driven company and everybody needs to be able to write and communicate well.
  • Curiosity. To excel in this role, you need to be able to build a deep understanding of each of the verticals we publish in. That means knowing the events, companies, products, and most importantly, people, in each of these verticals and having your finger to the pulse of any changes or developments.
Other nice-to-haves:
  • Experience in media sales
  • Experience in digital marketing
  • Familiarity with tools like outreach.io, Trello, Pipedrive, Mailchimp, and Excel
This is a remote, contract role. Successful SDRs may be able to move to full time sales roles on the Inside team.

Apply here: https://inside-com.breezy.hr/p/f9ce7f8b8017-sdr

items.content:

Sales Engineer -Remote Southern Indiana 1

Contech Engineered Solutions

Contech Engineered Solutions is seeking a Technical Sales Engineer to support our southern Indiana market. Our Sales Engineers work closely with engineering consultants, contractors and government officials providing engineering expertise and problem-solving advice. Under the direction of the Regional Vice President or Region Engineer, promotes and sells Contech's products to recognized or potential customers and dealers in an assigned geographic territory. Conducts all administrative matters incident to such sales in accordance with established policies and procedures. Works with minimal supervision.

Primary Responsibilities:- Works as a collaborative member of our sales team to sell company products.- Conducts sales presentations and obtains favorable specifications for our products.- Manages sales with and through distribution and develops quotes & orders.- Provides sales support for multiple projects. Consistently follow up on projects.- Provides project support for submittals, production and product delivery during construction.- Maintains engineering processes and procedures.- Identifies and develops territory potential. With minimal supervision, plans and organizes territory coverage and sales approach to assure most effective development of assigned sales territory in order to meet or exceed established objectives.- Develops and maintains statistical data on competitors' products, quality, sales, pricing, production facilities, limitations and marketing procedures.- Using established guidelines, negotiates terms and conditions of sales contracts involving sales price, discounts, freight, delivery, rejected or excess material disposition, etc., to assure a profit and a high level of customer satisfaction. Gathers necessary information for determination of credit worthiness by Headquarters. Monitors transactions through completion, including collections, in consultation with inside sales, and assists in resolving any discrepancies or making any changes during the course of the transaction.- Investigates customer complaints and claims through on-site visits when appropriate to determine merit and proper action, recommends adjustments or allowances, and advises customer of final disposition. Communicates commercial policies and practices to customers as necessary to assist them or to resolve any problem incident to the sale of Contech products.- Contacts established and prospective customers in assigned sales territory to provide close personal service; seeks out and develops new accounts and product applications, and increases market share.- Develops information on competitive price situations; verifies and analyzes quotations as to Contech's ability to meet customer proposals and makes recommendations.- Interfaces with customer representatives to ascertain project requirements and provide any necessary technical assistance or service. Gathers pertinent project information, and provides explanations and direction to customer on products and applications.- Performs plan takeoffs in conjunction with quotations and orders, prepares quotations, develops shipping schedules, writes and submits orders to Regional Office and/or plants.
